loans.name: Esperanza El Coco Group

texts.en:
Dania is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza El Coco (Hope, The Coconut), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.
Dania is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her coconut-selling business by purchasing coconuts as well as a machine with which to peel them. She will use the profits to invest in clothing and food for her family as well as finishing construction work on her home. Additionally, she would like to be able to help her daughter who is in university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts and a machine with which to peel them

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: El Sr. Hilario R. P. tiene 54 años de edad, con 3 hijos estudiantes, esta dedicado al transporte publico con moto taxi, es el sostén económico de su familia y puesto que esta herramienta de trabajo ya requiere de cambio es que solicita el crédito para poder comprar otra motocicleta que le permita continuar generando ingresos para su familia y sacar bachilleres a sus hijos. El nos dice que en un futuro le gustaria tener muchas motos y habrir su empresa de transporte (moto taxi), y asi mejorar mucho mas sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Hilario R. P. is 54 years old, and he has three children who go to school. He works with a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) in public transportation. This is the economic sustenance for his family. Given that his work tool now needs to be changed, he is asking for the loan to be able to buy another motorcycle. This will allow him to continue generating income for his family and for his children to get their high school degrees. He tells us that in the future he would like to have lots of motorcycles and to open a transportation company (mototaxi). That way he would greatly improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
María Zoila  P. es otra  socia del banco comunal  San Pedro, vive  en una casa arrendada  en la comunidad San Pedro en la parroquia Victoria de Portete en la parte suroccidental del cantón Cuenca.  En éste lugar encontramos  un majestuoso monumento en honor a los héroes de la Batalla de Tarqui, en este lugar se libró la batalla entre los ejércitos ecuatoriano comandado   por el Gral. Antonio José de Sucre y el peruano.

 Es nuestra socia  hace tres ciclos y es una mujer muy dinámica de  30 años, es casada y ha concebido seis hijos que se encuentran de 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, 1 años, sus cinco hijos estudian  en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es aserrador de árboles y ella se dedica a la costura hace diez años, esta labor la realiza en su  casa y  su especialidad es el bordado de polleras arte que le  enseño una compañera, no tiene un horario fijo ya que todo depende de las obras que tenga que realizar. Con el  crédito que obtendrá  va a comprar cuyes, pollos y alimento para iniciar un nuevo negocio de esta manera  tener otra fuente de ingresos.

Su meta es de terminar su casa que aún está en construcción.
texts.en:
María Zoila P. is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank. She lives in a rented house in the San Pedro community in the Victoria de Portete parrish. It is in the southwest part of the Cuenca canton. This is the place where we find the majestic monument honoring the heroes of the Battle of Tarqui. This site is where the battle took place between the Peruvian army and the Ecuadorian army commanded by General Antonio José de Sucre. She has been a member for three cycles. She is a very dynamic 30 year old woman. She is married and has six children. They are 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 1 years old. Five of her children go to school in the community. Her husband cuts trees. She has been working as a seamstress for ten years. She does this in her house, and her specialty is embroidering t-shirts. A friend taught her this art. She does not have a fixed schedule because everything depends upon the work that she has to do. She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicken, and feed to start a new business. This way she will have another source of income. Her goal is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs, chicken, and feed to start a new business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Nuestra socia Delfina se dedica a la venta de desayuno hace varios años lo hace en un mercado cerca de su casa. Sabe que tiene que mantener a sus 4 hijos es por eso que por las tardes vende comida en su casa. Su objetivo es poder brindar a sus hijos estudios profesionales además de construir su casa y tener más comodidad, Delfina agradece el préstamo ya que para ella es importante el capital de trabajo para seguir superándose. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Delfina has been selling breakfast for several years. She sells in the market near her house. She knows that she needs to support her four children. That is why she sells food from her house in the afternoons. Her objective is to be able to give her children an education to become professionals. She also wants to build a house and be more comfortable. Delfina is grateful for the loan. The work capital is important to her in order to keep improving herself. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING WOMEN'S, MEN'S AND CHILDREN'S CLOTHING, AND AVON PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Narcisa Angela

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa pertenece al banco comunal Los Bajos de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí ella nació en ese bello lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación y con atractivos turísticos para propios y extraños.

Narcisa Esta casada tiene 38 años, y con dos niños, se graduó muy joven en belleza en una academia de la ciudad y se dedica desde hace 5 años a ejercer lo aprendido decidió en tener su propio gabinete de belleza en su casa, donde realiza corte de cabellos, tientes, peinados y maquillaje, ella esta en constante seminarios para aprender mas de las ultimas tendencias en belleza, esta casada desde hace 20 años y el esposo la apoyo mucho el sabe que ama el trabajo, ha podido ir incrementando su local gracias a la iniciativa de una amiga que le comentó de la Fundación y la motivó y ya han transcurrido 8 ciclos que viene trabajando de la mano de Espoir.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Narcisa podrá comprar productos como shampoo, tintes, maquillaje y demás productos necesarios para su peluquería, el día que más trabajo tiene es el sábado y los demás días va a domicilio a pedido de sus clientas. El sueño de nuestra socia es poder tener una peluquería mas completa en la ciudad de Manta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa belongs to the Los Bajos de Montecristi Communal Bank in the province of Manabí. She was born in this lovely region, surrounded by much vegetation and tourist attractions for locals and outsiders. Narcisa is married, 38 years old, and has 2 children. She graduated very young from beauty school in the city and after dedicating herself for 5 years to practicing what she learned, she decided to open her own beauty shop in her house. There she cuts hair, tints, and does permanents and make up. She constantly attends seminars to learn more about the latest tendencies in beauty. Narcisa has been married 20 years and her husband helps her a great deal, understanding that she loves the work. She has been expanding her shop, thanks to the initiative of a friend who recommended her to the Foundation and motivated her. She has now completed 8 loan cycles, working with ESPOIR. With this new loan, Narcisa will be able to buy products like shampoo, tints, make up and other things needed in her beauty shop. Her busiest day is Saturday and on other days, she goes by request to her customers' homes. Her dream is to be able to have a more complete beauty salon in the city of Manta.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TINTS, SHAMPOO, AND MAKE UP FOR HER BEAUTY SALON

loans.name: Nidia Amarilis

texts.es: Nidia Amarilis P. V. de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es una joven la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre esta dispuesta a hacer algo más por el bienestar de sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, así mismo para solventar los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Nidia comercializa ropa para mujeres y hombre, calzado y cosméticos, los cuales vende de forma ambulante ya que de esta manera ella puede vender más productos. Así mismo cuando sus ventas son muy pocas, ella trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar en diferentes casas, ya que esto le permite obtener algo de ganancias extras, de esta manera ella puede obtener más dinero para invertir en la ropa y los cosméticos, lo que en muchas ocasiones no da a basto. Nidia solicita  un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más cosméticos en diferentes marcas y precios y así mismo más ropa y zapatos, de manera que las ganancias que obtiene haciendo oficio ajeno puedan ser por completo para el sustento de sus dos pequeños.
texts.en:
Nidia Amarilis is 27 years old and resides in the municipality of San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. She is a young person who can count on very good references from her neighbors. She is always disposed to do something more for the wellbeing of her 2 children of 10 and 5 years of age, and also to contribute along side her husband, to household income. Nidia sells women's and men's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, in the streets, since she can sell more products that way. Also, when her sales are few, she does housework in different homes, since this permits her to contribute extra income. In this way, she can obtain more money to invest in clothing and cosmetics which on many occasions, she doesn't have enough of. Nidia is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics of different brands and prices and, also, more clothing and shoes, so that her working earnings may be adequate for sustaining her two little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTHING, COSMETICS, AND SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Nelly Norma

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, se reúne en la parroquia Los Bajos en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

La señora norma es casada tiene 7 hijos mayores ella se dedica a  su casa  y le ayuda la esposo con el préstamo que esta solicitando llevan 10 años en el negocio de ladrillos el negocio esta ubicado por la vía,   tierra aserrín, es para invertir en el negocio familiar, en la vía tiene 7 hijos dos casados, el mayor le ayuda en la casa en la alimentación, el horno se arma a base tierra, aserrín y agua y lo maja y lo ponen en un molde y lo dejan secar, tiene 3 trabajadores según lo que se vende ellos ganan los vende en Portoviejo y hace contratos en las construcciones, cada mes 10.000 ladrillos, los ladrillos el millar esta por los costo 80 dólares y cuando no llueve bajan las ventas, todos los ladrillos que sacan los venden, ella es la que se encarga de preparar los 

alimentos para los trabajadores de su negocio, desde las 4 de la mañana, tratan de madrugar porque como trabajan al aire libre sin cubrirse del sol, es un trabajo bastante sacrificado, con el negocio tiene 10 años, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en comprar los materiales para construir un nuevo horno, los quemadores de martes a viernes.
texts.en:
The community bank Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer meets in the parish church Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi in the province of Manabí. Señora Norma is married and has 7 grown sons, 2 of whom are married. She works out of her home along with her husband, who is helping her with the loan which she requests. For ten years they have worked in the business of bricks, and the loan which they request is to invest in their familiar trade of making bricks. The eldest of her sons helps her at home, preparing food for the workers who make the bricks for their company. To make bricks, Señora Norma's husband and their workers load their brick-baking oven with a base mixture of dirt, sawdust and water, which they grind together and put in a mold, where they leave it to dry in the oven. They have 3 workers, who are paid an amount that corresponds to the amount of bricks they sell. They sell their bricks in Portoviejo, and make contracts with construction companies, requiring them to produce 10,000 bricks per month. They charge 80 dollars per thousand bricks, and when it does not rain, their sales go down, since there is less water to use for producing bricks. They sell all the bricks that they are able to bake. Señora Norma is the one in charge of preparing food for the workers who produce the bricks for their business. Everyone tries to begin working by 4 a.m., because at that hour they can work in the open air without having to protect themselves from the harsh mid-day sun. It is difficult work, requiring the sacrifice of comfort, and they have worked hard at it for 10 years. With this newest loan, they will purchase materials to build a new oven, which will be firing bricks from Tuesday to Friday.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar materiales para construir  horno para ladrillos

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Atenas del Ecuador está formado por un grupo de mujeres visionaria, dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias como la señora  Olga Álvarez es socia de éste banco hace diez años, vive en su casa propia aunque pequeña con su esposo que trabaja conduciendo un taxi y sus cinco hijos de seis ya que la mayor es casada y vive independiente, sus hijos de 26 y 24 años trabajan y aportan económicamente para la casa,  sus tres últimos hijos estudian en la Universidad y colegio respectivamente.  Este banco se encuentra en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en el año 1999. 

Nuestra socia es dueña de una tienda de víveres hace veinte años, labora en su negocio desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. se siente  muy contenta de formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres ya que durante todos estos años han llegado a tener lazos muy fuertes de compañerismo y amistad  con todas  las socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que reciba del credito solicitado  va a comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, artículos de limpieza y cuidado personal para abastecer su tienda.

Su meta es llegar a ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
The Atenas Communal Bank of Ecuador is made up of a group of visionary women, like Olga Álvarez, who are prepared to help their families get ahead. Olga has been a member of this bank for ten years. Her house, although small, is her own, and she lives there with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and five of their six children. The eldest daughter is married and lives elsewhere. Her 26- and 24-year-old work and help support the family, while the three youngest study in college and high school respectively. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, capital of the Azuay Province, which is located in the southern part of Ecuador's Andean mountain range; it is the third most important city in Ecuador and is known for maintaining the tranquility and beauty of an ancient city. Its historic center was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1999. Olga has run a grocery store for 20 years. She works from 6 am until 9 pm. She is very happy to be part of this beautiful group of women since through the years they have all developed strong ties of companionship and friendship. With the loan money, she will buy rice, sugar, salt, pasta, cleaning products and personal care products to stock her store. Her goal is to be able to add on to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, pasta, cleaning products and personal care products to stock her store

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.en:
Claribel is the coordinator of her group, Las M., and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.
Claribel is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing a machine to impress metal to make jewelry and the metal to use in the machine. She will use her profits to invest in the re-modelling of her home and school supplies for her children. She would also like to save to travel to the US to visit her family there. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a machine with which to make jewelry and the metal to use in it

loans.name: Neftalí Antonio

texts.es: Neftalí Antonio M. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo esta conformado por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo le ayuda a Neftalí con el trabajo, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijas de 12, 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Neftalí se encarga de elaborar camas de junco, un trabajo muy escaso, por lo que puede venderlo a muy buenos precios por ser un producto artesanal, el cual se comercializa en gran manera con personas extranjeras. Su venta este ubicada sobre la calle principal de Ilopango, en donde coloca las camas sobre la acera, con lo cual obtiene mayor visibilidad de los posibles clientes. Neftalí solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más junco y así mismo toda la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de camas. Él es un padre de familia muy responsable, el cual trabaja muy duro por salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Naphtali Antonio M. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. His family is comprised of his wife, who is engaged in household chores which helps Naphtali to concentrate on his work, and their three daughters, ages 12, 10 and 9, who are studying in school . Naphtali takes to the task making reed beds, an uncommon trade. He can sell them at very good prices as a handmade product, which are sold largely to foreigners. Their point of sale is located on the main street of Ilopango, where the beds are placed on the sidewalk, thereby obtaining greater visibility to potential customers. Naphtali requesting a loan so that he can buy more reeds and the raw materials necessary for the production of beds. He is a very responsible parent, who works very hard to get ahead with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reeds to make beds

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer en el sector rural de la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

Ella esta casada tiene 27 años y tiene 3 niños, están pequeños aun, el esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado, tiene una tienda desde hace 3 años, de a poco empezó con pocas cosas, además vende bisutería, bebidas, ha podido comprarse una  refrigeradora, quiere incrementar su negocio por eso está solicitando este nuevo crédito , le ha ido muy bien trabajando con la Fundación  desea poder tener su tienda mas surtida, decidió invertir en este negocio una vez que dejo de trabajar en una fábrica de pescado cuando salió embarazada de su tercer bebe, además la ubicación de su tienda es muy estratégica está en la vía principal.

La señora María Eugenia tiene que saber compartir el tiempo para atender a sus hijos que están pequeños y entrar a estudiar este año y tiene que trabajar más, desea que la situación económica mejore.
En estos momentos ella vive en casa de su mamá, y su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa para poder brindarles una mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) commual bank in a rural area of the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. She is 27 years old, married and has three young children. Her husband works in a fish processing factory. She has had a small general store for the last three years. She started out selling just a few items and also sells novelties and beverages. She has manged to buy herself a refrigerator. She is asking for new funds to enlarge her store. She has done very well working with the Foundation and wants to have a better-stocked store. When she became pregnant with her third child she decided to stop working at the fish processing plant and invest in her own business. Her store is strategically located on the main street. Maria Eugenia knows that she must divide her time among caring for her children who are still little and enrolling in school; she as to work more because she wants her economic situation to improve. She currently lives in her mother’s house and her greatest wish is to have her own home to provide her children with more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy novelties, beverages and food items.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
EL Señor Dario H. R. tiene 28 años y está casado con la Señora Seberina Torrico Carballo por más de 6 años total tiene 3 hijos que estudian. El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi y Cochabamba, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser ama de casa y cuidando de sus animales.  
                                                                                                                                                                                      El señor Dario H. R. vive hacia el norte de Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Piyorata zona rural, el crédito utilizara para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) para agrandar mas su producción agrícola y la compra de una cabeza de ganado vacuno. 
                                                                                                                                                                   El señor Dario H. R. nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir un poco más cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficies sus cultivos de producción agrícola porque a la vez es un recurso económico para mantener la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
El señor Dario H. R. is 28 years old and has been married to la Señora Seberina Torrico Carballo for more than 6 years. They have 3 children in school. The gentleman cultivates potatoes, broad beans, oca (an edible root), and papa liza (a tuber) and sells them in the Colomi and Cochabamba weekly market. His wife helps him cultivate these vegetables, in addition to caring for their house and their animals. El señor Dario H. R. lives north of Colomi, in the Segunda Candelaria neighborhood, Piyorata rural zone. The loan proceeds will be used to buy organic fertilizer (poultry manure) to increase yield and to buy one head of cattle. The gentleman told us that his dream is to continue to increase his income so that his children can continue to study and become professionals. In addition, he wishes to improve the quality of his residence in order to live a little more comfortably with his family. Finally, he said he will sow his crops over a larger area because his crops also ensure that his family will have a secure supply of food.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer and one head of cattle

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora del Carmen P. de 55 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposo, una hija y un nieto. Su esposo es quien se encarga de la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar, él trabaja como comerciante de productos varios y los vende de forma ambulantes, de esta misma forma Dinora se dedica a comerciar ropa, cosméticos y accesorios para el cabello, su venta se encuentra en el centro de San Miguel, un lugar muy concurrido, en el cual obtiene ganancias diarias, las cuales son muy aceptables. A pesar de esto el mayor deseo de Dinora es el de poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que de esta manera, ella podrá contar con una vida mejor, la cual esté suplida de todo lo necesario para vivir. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar diferentes tallas y estilos de ropa, así mismo más cosméticos y todo tipo de accesorios para el cabello, sobre todo aquellos que están muy de moda, de manera que sus ventas se puedan ver incrementadas y su negocio sea prosperado.
texts.en:
Dinora del Carmen P., 55, lives in San Miguel department with her husband, a daughter and her grandson. Most of the household expenses are covered by her husband who is an itinerant salesman of assorted merchandise. Dinora is a clothing, cosmetics and hair accessories merchant; she sells her wares in downtown San Miguel, a very busy area, where she earns quite acceptable daily profits. Despite this, however, Dinora wants to increase her sales because this will allow her to live a better life, one that has everthing needed to live. For this reason, she is asking for funding to buy various styles and sizes of clothing as well as cosmetics and all kinds of hair accessories, especially those that are most in fashion, so that her sales will increase and her business will progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and hair accessories.

loans.name: Judy Sulema

texts.es: Judy Sulema C. C. de 20 años de edad, reside en Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. A su corta edad, Judy trabaja para poder sostener un hogar y a dos hermanos los cuales tienen 15 y 8 años de edad, los cuales están al total cuidado de Judy. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de Tacachico, un lugar muy apropiado para este tipo de ventas, ya que ha pesar que en algunas ocasiones sus ventas son pocas, las obtiene a diario. Judy es una personas muy emprendedor quien desea mejorar su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda surtir el negocio, comprando productos por mayor, y de esta forma ella pueda aumentar sus ventas. Esto es de mucha importancia para Judy ya que es la única que trabaja para mantener a su familia, por lo que su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Judy Sulema C. C., age 20, lives in Tacachico, which is located in the La Libertad department. At her young age, Judy works to be able to support a household and her two siblings. They are 15 and 8 years old, and they are totally under Judy’s care. She has a store in which she sells basic needs items. It is located in the market in Tacachico, which is a very appropriate place for this type of sales. Even though sometimes she has few sales, she makes daily sales. Judy is a very hard-working person who wants to improve her business. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. She will use the loan to stock her business by purchasing wholesale products. That way she will be able to increase her sales. This is very important to Judy because she is the only one who works to support her family. Therefore, her greatest desire is to be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 2,3 Group

texts.en:
Apolonia is the coordinator of her group, Desarrollo Comunitario (Community Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.
Apolonia is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing shirts, pants, skirts and bracelets in the capital and then selling them at profit in her community. She will also purchase a cash register. Apolonia will use her profits to invest in remodeling her home as well as purchasing school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, skirts, bracelets and a cash register

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR PANFILO LLEGO EL AÑO 1983  DE LA PROVINCIA AYOPAYA, COMUNIDAD SAN CRISTOBAL DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA, EN BUSCA DE MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE TRABAJO, PARA PODER SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMIL.IA Y MEJORAR SU NIVEL DE VIDA. EL SEÑOR PAMFILO EN LOS PRIMEROS AÑOS TRABAJO COMO PEON, POSTERIORMENTE FUE PARTIDARIO DE OTRAS PERSONAS QUE TENIAN LOTE AGRICOLA, POCO A POCO FUE AHORRANDO PARA COMPRARSE SU PROPIO TERRENO AGRICOLA, ACTUALMENTE EL SEÑOR TIENE  CINCO HIJOS DE LOS CUALES SON DOS VARONES, LOS CUALES AYUDAN A SU PADRE EN SU LABOR DE DIARIO, ELLOS PRODUCEN PALMITO Y CITRICOS, PERO TAMBIEN PIENSAN COLOCAR OTROS CULTIVOS PARA PODER SEGUIR ADELANTE. ELLOS NOS PIDEN EL CREDITO PARA PODER PONER UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO PARA SU ESPOSA PARA PODER CONTAR CON ALGUNOS INGRESOS EXTRAS.
texts.en:
Panfilo arrived in 1983. He came from the Ayopaya province in the San Cristobal community, Cochabamba department. He came looking for better work opportunities in order to get his family ahead and improve their standard of living. In the first years Panfilo worked as a farm worker. Later, he followed other people who had agricultural land. Little by little he was saving to buy his own agricultural land. He now has five children. Two are boys, and they help their father with the daily work. They produce palm hearts and citrus. He is also planning on planting other crops in order to be able to get ahead. They are asking us for the loan to be able to establish a neighborhood store for his wife. This is to be able to count on some extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a neighborhood store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto R. P. de 61 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa, y tres hijos.  Roberto posee una panadería en la cual se encargan de hacer pan dulce y salado, en el negocio le ayuda su esposa y uno de sus hijos, quien se encarga de repartir el pan de forma ambulante en una bicicleta, cada madruga y cada tarde, él se encarga de repartir el pan con los diferentes clientes. Así mismo tanto Roberto como su esposa elaboran el pan y lo comercializa en su casa lugar en el cual esta ubicada la panadería. Este es un negocio familiar, por medio del cual obtienen el dinero necesario para salir adelante, es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar harina, sal, levadura, y una batidora para hacer la mezcla del pan, de esta forma Roberto espera aumentar su producción y mejorar las condiciones del negocio y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto R. P. is 61 and lives with his wife and three children in the Sonsonate department. Roberto has a bakery where he makes regular and sweet breads. His wife helps him with his business as well as one of his children who is in charge of delivering the bread on his bicycle. He goes out very early every morning and in the afternoon and takes the bread to the different customers. Both Roberto and his wife make the bread and sell it in their house, where the bakery is located. This is a family business and that is how they get the money necessary to progress. For this reason they are asking for a loan which they will use to buy flour, salt, yeast, and a mixer to make the bread. Roberto hopes to increase his production and improve the working conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, salt, yeast and a mixer to make bread

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia J. F. de 29 años, posee una tortillería en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de su madre quien trabaja para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Dora es madre soltera, quien por esta razón trabaja muy duro realizando diferentes actividades como vender tamales los fines de semana y de lunes a domingo vender pupusas y tortillas, ella es una persona que no tiene descanso, ya que su mayor anhelo es el de poder suplir todas las necesidades básicas de su familia, si importar el esfuerzo que eso implique. Dora solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir más en sus ventas comprando la materia prima más importante para su trabajo la cual es el maíz, este producto ella espera comprarlo por mayor y así mismo comprar queso, chicharrón, algunas verduras y otros alimentos más los cuales le hagan posible vender más.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia J. F. is 29 years old and manages a tortilla shop from her home in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her three children (ages 17, 15, and 9) who are dedicated to their studies. Thanks to the help of her mother, Dora is able to work so that she can provide everything her children need since they are completely dependent on her.

Dora is a single mother, so she works very hard in different activities such as selling tamales on the weekends and selling pupusas and tortillas Monday through Sunday. She is a person who does not rest. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide for all the basic needs of her family, regardless of the amount of effort required. Dora is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy the most important ingredient used in her work, which is corn. She hopes to acquire this product in bulk, as well as cheese, pork rinds, vegetables, and other foods that will make it possible for her to sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, pork rinds, vegetables, and other foods

loans.name: Las Vecinas 3 Group

texts.en:
Epifania is the coordinator of her group Las Vecinas (The neighbors), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple structure with her husband  and three children.

Epifaniais is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts and shoes to sell. She will use the profits to purchase food and medicine as well as a computer for her children. She is also saving towards being able to have her business in a permanent location. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts and shoes to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen P. N. de 30 años de edad, reside en pequeño pueblo de Ilobasco, el cual es muy conocido por sus artesanos, quienes hacen diferentes figuras de barro, lugar en el cual llegan muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. María vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como empleado de la Policía Nacional Civil, y junto a sus dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad. María como toda mujer responsable quien vela por el bienestar de su familia, se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual le permite aportar para los gastos familiares, por lo que ella desde hace más de 5 años ejerce este oficio. Cada semana ella llega a la frontera con Guatemala para comprar la ropa la cual comercializa en el pueblo de Ilobasco, en donde realiza todas sus ventas las cuales son diarias. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y así mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su mayor deseo.
texts.en:
María del Carmen P. N. is 30 years old and resides in the small town of Ilobasco, which is well-known for its artisans who make various clay figures. This place is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. María lives with her husband, who is employed by the National Civil Police, and their two children (ages 7 and 13). Like all responsible women, María looks after her family’s welfare. She sells clothing for men and women, which allows her to contribute to the family expenses. María has been in this business for more than five years. Each week she travels to the Guatemalan border to buy clothes to bring back to Ilobasco, where she makes all of her daily sales.

María is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a large quantity of clothing so that she can improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana Delmy N. de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, esto lo hace con el deseo de poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con quien viven en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en la capital del país la cual es San Salvador. Ana comercializa la ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos como Cojutepeque, Ilobasco, Sensuntepeque, los cuales están ubicados en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Ella recorre grandes distancias para poder vender por lo menos la mitad de su mercadería diaria, de esta manera ella se asegura poder obtener ganancias las cuales no solo le permitan solventar los gastos de la casa, sino también, seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es algo difícil. Es por esto que Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para comprar más ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Delmy N. is 40 years old and sells clothing for men and women in order to provide for her needs. She lives with her husband in Ilopango, which is located in San Salvador, the national capital. Ana sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor in different towns such as Cojutepeque, Ilobasco, and Sensuntepeque, which are all located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She walks great distances to conduct her business and is able to sell at least half of her daily inventory, which enables her to cover her household expenses. Ana also earns enough to reinvest in her business, which is often difficult to do.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to buy more clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different styles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Marina Edith

texts.es: Marina Edith Q. M. de 54 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para niños y niñas, la cual comercializa en las diferentes plazas de Santa Tecla así como también en el departamento de San Miguel y Usulután al oriente del país. Marina vive junto a tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y se dedican a trabajar, el menor de 20 años de edad, trabaja junto a  Marina y es quien se dedica de cargar la ropa por todos los lugares que la venden, lo cual es una gran ayuda para Marina ya que de esta manera pueden recorrer más colonias y plazas vendiendo la ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior en diferentes estilos los cuales no posee y que puedan llamar más la atención de los niños de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marina Edith Q. M. is 54 years old and resides in the city of Santa Tecla, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She sells undergarments for boys and girls at different sites throughout Santa Tecla, as well as the Departments of San Miguel and Usulután in the eastern part of the country. Marina lives with her three adult children who are involved in their work. Her oldest child is 20 years old and helps her with transporting the clothes to all the places where she sells them. This has been a great help to Marina because it allows her to travel to more places to generate sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of undergarments in different styles that she does not have in stock. This will allow her to serve more children and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's undergarments to sell

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es: Dolores Elizabeth B. D. P. D. 30 años D. edad, es una persona muy carismática y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos, tanto por ser muy responsable como por ser excelente persona, quien se dedica a su hogar y a su familia. Ella vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 5 y 8 años D. edad. Dolores posee un salón D. belleza en el cual se encarga D. realizar diferentes tipos D. trabajo para el cabello, así mismo comercializa productos para el cuidado D. la piel y del cabello, así mismo venD. cosméticos y ropa. Ella es muy emprendedora, quien cuenta con el deseo D. salir adelante por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos y D. esta manera poder realizar más trabajo y vender más productos. Dolores desea aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera brindarle un mejor presente y futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores Elizabeth B. D. P. is 30 years old and known for being a very charismatic and hardworking person. Her neighbors have provided good references on her behalf, stating that she is responsible and dedicated to her home and family. Dolores lives in the Department of Sonsonate with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8. She manages a beauty salon that provides different hair services. In addition, she sells hair and skin care products and clothing.

Dolores is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to purchase a large quantity of products. This will help her generate more business and increase her sales so that she can proviD. both a better present and future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Cristo Vive 1,2 Group

texts.en:

loans.use: to buy women's and men's shoes, skirts, pants and shirts to sell

loans.name: David 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, David, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane industry dominates the economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Maria is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase 34 large five-gallon water bottles which she will distribute in smaller qunatities. She will use the profits to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy large water bottles

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto tiene 47 años de edad se encuentra casado con la señora Martina López tiene tres hijos uno de 15 años el otro de 18 años y el ultimo de 10 años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Kuluyo de la provincia de Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba él es agrícola ya hace como 20 años el trabaja junto con su esposa en sembrar diferentes tubérculos como papa  la oca como también verduras entre ellos arvejas y habas.

Benedicto es un persona muy trabajadora el de niño tuvo una vida muy difícil al ser el mayor de cinco hermanos tuvo que sacarlos adelante a todos  ya que cuando eran niños su padre murió en un accidente en el trabajo (albañil) se cayó de la construcción de un edificio y la madre se volvió alcohólica   al encontrarse sola con sus hijos , Benedicto se puso a trabajar y a ayudar a sus hermanos el dejo la escuela  no podía trabajar en el campo con los sembradíos de sus familiares y los de su padre y estudiar ya que la escuela del pueblo solo funcionaba en la mañana .

Benedicto solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas porque ya empezara la época de la cosecha de papa y otras verduras, el necesita comprar las semillas y el abono que es especial para la cosecha  y de esa manera el tendrá más ingresos, porque su esposa al mismo tiempo se dedica a la producción de quesillo que lo realiza para poder vender en el pueblo, porque ellos trabajan de esta manera para que sus hijos puedan tener una vida mejor  puedan terminar el colegio y hasta poder realizar alguna carrera Benedicto sueña con que su  hija pequeña pueda estudiar para ser profesora y poder ayudar a los niños que viven con padres alcohólicos como un día fue él y así no dejaran esos niños de estudiar  y tendrán un futuro mejor el está muy orgulloso de su familia y de sus esposa porque ella siempre la va apoyando en todo momento y cuidad a su familia que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 47 years old and is married to Martina Lopez with whom he has three children who are 10, 15, and 18 years old. They live in the Kuluyo community in the Sacaba province of the city of Cochabamba. He has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years; he works with his wife growing crops like potatoes, peas, and beans. Benedicto is a hard-working person who has had a difficult life since he was a child; he was the oldest of 5 children and he had to take care of his family after the death of his father. His father worked in construction and passed away when a building fell on top of him; Benedicto's mother became an alcoholic after being widowed with her 4 children. Benedicto started to work and he left school to help his siblings; he couldn't work in the fields and study at the same time because the school only ran in the mornings. Benedicto is seeking a loan to buy seeds as planting season for potatoes and vegetables is approaching; he needs to buy seeds and fertilizer which will help his crops and improve his income. His wife works making cheese which she sells in the town. They both work hard so that their children can have a better life, finish school and hopefully find better work in the future. Benedicto dreams of helping his young daughter to study to become a teacher who can help teach the children of alcoholic parents--just as he used to be. In this way, these kids won't have to stop studying and will have a better future. He is very proud of his family and of his wife because she is always supporting him; taking care of his family is the most important thing in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente Group

texts.en:
Disiana, 63, is the coordinator of her group Cristo La Fuente (Christ is the Source), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area dominated by the sugarcane industry and characterized by the Haitian workers who live there; running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and her two grown children.

Disiana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (running a small food stand) by purchasing more bananas, bread and cookies to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, which she would like to grow into a small store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Bananas, cookies and bread to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 43 ans elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SARE DEMBA ALETTE depuis 3 ans et demi et a 07 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficultés de remboursement. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce de thé, de sucre, de colas, d'huile de palme et de cigarette. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 43-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has been a member of the village loan group of Sare Demba Alette for 3 and a half years, and has received 7 successive loans, all of which she had no difficulty repaying. Her new loan will allow her to further develop her small business selling tea, sugar, colas, palm oil, and cigarettes. Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Manuela P. forma parte del Banco P. comunal Nuevo Amanecer, se reúnen en el sitio Los Bajos de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

La señora Manuela es ama de casa, pero a la vez en su casa tiene una tienda de víveres, vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas hidratantes y más productos, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 23 años empezó el negocio el papá fue quien les ayudó cuando recién se casaron el les dio el capital para que tengan como ayudarse, en su casa ha acondicionado un espacio tipo kiosco, en los actúales momentos han atravesado por dificultades y los créditos de la Fundación han sido de gran ayuda para no dejar caer su  negocio, el esposo se dedica a trabajos eventuales, en fincas y en fabricas de ladrillos es poco lo que gana, con este nuevo crédito la señora Manuela podrá abastecer el negocio no tiene necesidad de salir a la ciudad le visitan los proveedores de productos, les va bien en las ventas y con eso está ayudando a sus hijos en el estudio y tiene que sacar las ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desde muy temprano está en pie para abrir su tienda y no hay hora fija en cerrar, lo único que desea nuestra socia es cumplir los sueños de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela P. is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank which meets in Los Bajos de Montecristi, Manabí province. Manuela is a housewife but in addition to that she has a grocery store where she stocks rice, sugar, hydrating beverages and other products. She has three children. She started her business 23 years ago and it was her father who helped her out with the initial capital when she got married so that they would have a means of support. A space in her house was set up like a sales kiosk. Currently, they have gone through some difficult times and loans from the Foundation have permitted them to keep the business going. Her husband is a temporary worker on large farming estates and in brick factories but he earns very little. Manuela will use this new funding to stock the store. She doesn’t need to go to the city for goods, distributors come to her. Sales are good and profits have been helpful to pay for the children’s education plus she has to earn enough to cover household expenses. She is up very early in the morning to open for business and she doesn’t have a fixed closing time; all she wants is that her family’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like: rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Renovacion De Las Aguilas 4 Group

texts.en:
Briselda is the coordinator of her group Ronovacion de Las Aguilas (Renewal of the Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their child.

Briselda is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to purchase more cleaning products and laundry detergent to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, which she wants to grow as rapidly as possible. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cleaning products, laundry detergent

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores Q. es una señora es una señora de 39 años, tiene 3 hijas, viven solas en zona la Maica Norte zona agrícola de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Dolores se dedica a la elaboración de quesillos y su comercialización, si bien ella solo cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganando entonces solo elabora 40 quesillos cada día, pero la señora Dolores compra de sus vecinas mas quesillos y lleva todos sus productos al mercado Campesino (mercado popular de Cochabamba), además compra maíz de sus vecinos y hace cocer y elabora mote, entonces logra comercializar tanto mote como quesillo, Dolores siempre con ayuda de una de sus hijas lleva todos los días sus quesillo y su mote al mercado desde las 7 hasta las10 de la mañana logra vender todo, pues el quesillo es un producto perecedero si no se refrigera. Dolores es una señora trabajadora pero quedo sola pues sus esposo las dejo desde hace 5 años, afortunadamente ellas no extrañas su presencia pues era una persona irresponsable, alcohólico que las agredía verbal y físicamente, ellas aun tienen ese trauma de esos años tan difíciles que atravesaron. Su hija mayor tiene 12 años la pequeña se encarga de ayudar a su mama todas las mañanas y por las tardes estudia. Pero para la edad que tiene es muy responsable y consiente.

La señora Dolores ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado vacuno para poder elaborar mas quesillos e incrementar sus ingresos y así con el tiempo con la suma de todos sus ingresos poder invertir un insumos.
texts.en:
Dolores Q., 39, has three daughters; she lives alone with them in Maica Norte, a farming area of Cercado province, Cochabamba department. Dolores is a cheese merchant. However, because she only owns four cows she only makes 40 cheeses daily. However, she buys more cheese from her neighbors and takes all the product to the Campesino market (a very popular market in Cochabamba). In addition, she buys corn from her neighbors, cooks it and makes popcorn. She is, therefore, able to sell both cheese and popcorn. With help from one of her daughters, Dolores takes all her cheese and popcorn to the market every day from 7am until 10am; she manages to sell out her cheese because it is a perishable item that requires refrigeration. Dolores is a hard-working woman who was left alone when her husband left her 5 years ago. Fortunately, she doesn’t miss him because he was an irresponsible, alcoholic person who abused her both physically and verbally; she is still traumatized by those difficult years they went through Her oldest daughter is 12 years old and she helps her mother every morning; during the afternoons she studies. She is very responsible and conscientious for her age. Dolores has requested funds to buy a cow so that she can increase cheese production thereby increasing her income so that, in the long run, adding all her income together, she can invest in ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 41 años de edad, separada, pero de dicho compromiso tiene 3 hijos, Anderson de 15 años, David de 7 años y Alex de 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 4 años se dedica ofrecer comida en un pequeño puesto que alquiló cerca de una posta médica. Es así que da el servicio de desayunos, almuerzos, gaseosas, golosinas, motivo por le cual las personas frecuentan su establecimiento y eso le da ventaja en las ganancias. A ella le gusta su trabajo pues lo realiza tranquilamente, además ha hecho buenos amigos en la zona, entre ellos los clientes fieles que van a su negocio. Amelia trabaja desde tempranas horas pues debe preparar el desayuno, al medio día esta muy ocupada atendiendo a sus comensales que la visitan para degustar sus ricos platillos y por las tardes ya se encuentra más tranquila vendiendo gaseosas y otros pequeños productos. En adelante desea ampliar su local y para ello comprará mesas y otros muebles para dar mayor comodidad a su clientela. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y asegura que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gaseosas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Amelia, 41, is separated. She has three children: Anderson, 15, David, 7 and Alex, 5. They all live together in their own home. For over four years she has sold prepared meals in a small stand she rents near a medical center. She provides breakfasts, lunches, soft-drinks and sweets which attracts many customers and this is an advantage to her with respect to profits. She enjoys her work because she can work peacefully and she has made some good friendships in the area, among them, her regular customers. Amelia opens for business very early in the morning because she knows she must prepare breakfast; at lunch time she’s busy taking care of diners who come to enjoy her delicious dishes and in the afternoons things are a bit quieter and she only sells soft-drinks and other small items. For the future she would like to enlarge her establishment and will buy more tables and chairs to do so in order to provide more comfort for her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be punctual with all her payments. She will use the requested funds to buy soft-drinks and ingredients to prepare her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Lucelia

texts.es:
Lucelia S. es una muchacha joven de 19 años, que tiene un bebe de 1 año, vive en la zona de la Maica Central parada 7, localidad ubicada en la periferia de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.

Lucelia se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir para varón, específicamente pantalones de jeans. Su mamá viajó a España hace 2 años, desde entonces ella se quedo al cuidado de su tía, pero la mala influencia de sus amigas y su ingenuidad, la llevaron a la situación por la que paso, tuvo a su bebe y se quedo sola sin apoyo del padre de su bebe, desde entonces, Lucelia trabaja mucho se levanta muy de madrugada para ir a comprar pantalones por docenas a los mayoristas, luego en un puesto de venta que tiene en el Mercado La Paz, mercado popular de Cochabamba, vende toda la mercadería a precios unitarios, es así que día a día Lucelia se gana la vida. Realiza sus actividades siempre en compañía de su bebe, pues no tiene quien le ayude a  cuidar a su bebe.

Lucelia solicito un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería, al comprar más mercadería, podrá incrementar mas sus ingresos, y seguir invirtiendo. Lucelia es un joven muy emprendedora, que tiene deseos de superación, a pesar que ella no ha estudiando ninguna carrera, sabe administrar sus ingresos, y su deseo es poder tener su propia tienda, grande, con mas productos para vender, así sus ingresos serian mayores, y no tendría muchos problemas para poder sostener a su bebe.
texts.en:
Lucelia S. is a young woman of 19 years old. She has a 1 year old baby and lives in the zone of Maica Central, stop 7, located in the periphery of the Cercado province in Cochabamba department, Bolivia. Lucelia sells men's clothes, specifically jeans. Her mother travelled to Spain 2 years ago and since then Lucelia has been under the care of her aunt. However her friends' bad influence and her own ingenuity let her to a situation where she had a baby a year ago. Since then, Lucelia has worked very hard. She gets up very early to buy dozens of jeans, and later sells them in a stand in the La Paz market, a very popular market in Cochabamba. She sells all her clothes in unit prices, and in this way day by day earns her living. Lucelia always carries out her work with the company of her baby, as she doesn't have anyone to care for it. Lucelia is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise, and in turn generate more earnings, and continue investing them. She is a very empresarial woman, and greatly desires to improve her situation. She hasn't ever studied a career, but knows how to administer her earnings. Her dream is to have her own large shop with a greater variety of products to sell, as she would then have better earnings, and wouldn't have many problems being able to sustain her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (purchase inventory)

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou M. est âgée de 71 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 04 ans et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers tels que: du riz, du sucre, du thé, de l'huile etc. son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'investissement en terme de marchandises. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Salimatou M. is a 71-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has been a member of the local village loan group for 4 years, and has benefited from 8 successive loans. She runs a small business selling various products such as rice, sugar, tea, oil, etc. Her loan will allow her to strengthen the level of her business in terms of her stocks of merchandise. Her goal is to take part in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her capital and increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Sebastian Efrain

texts.es: EL SEÑOR SEBASTIAN A. O. TIENE 27 AÑOS Y VIVE EN EL BARRIO 4 DE JULIO DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA . SEBASTIAN AUN NO ES CASADO Y VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ALQUILER , SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DEL SERVICIO DE GOMERIA . SUS PADRES LE DOTARON DE UN TERRENO DONDE EL ESTA CONSTRUYENDO UNA VIVIENDA . SEBASTIAN TIENE PENSADO FORMAR UN HOGAR , TENER HIJOS Y NIETOS. EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO SERA DESTINADO A LA MANO DE OBRA FINA DE SU VIVIENDA QUE ESTA EN CONSTRUCCION.   SEBASTIAN NOS CUENTA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES TENER SU VIVIENDA TERMINADA .TAMBIEN NOS CUENTA QUE EL PROXIMO CREDITO QUE SOLICITE  LO HARA PARA LA COMPRA DE GANADO PUESTO QUE ESO ES ALGO QUE SIMPRE LE APASIONO.
texts.en:
Sebastian A. O. is 27 years old. He lives in the suburb of 4 de Julio in Tarija City. Sebastian isn't married yet and lives in a rented house. He has a tyre and mechanic business. His parents equipped him with a piece of land where he is constructing a house. Sebastian is thinking of building a home there, and having children and grandchildren. The loan he is seeking is destined to pay for manual labour to build his house, which is under construction. Sebastian tells us that his biggest dream is to finish his house. He also tells us that the next loan he will seek will be for the purchase of livestock, as it is something he has always been passionate about.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of United Growth (Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas) Group

texts.en:
The name of this group, “Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas” translates as “The Women´s Bank of United Growth”. The eight women members live in Aguas Frías, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica.

The members of this group are involved in various income-generating activities including sewing, animal rearing (chickens, cows and pigs) as well as the harvesting of plantains, rice and watermelons. This loan will be used generally by the members to invest in the growth of their individual productive activities. The women involved in animal rearing plan to use this loan to purchase livestock and animal feed.

The women of this group are able to contribute significantly to their family incomes as a result of the earnings generated from their productive activities. This income is supplemented by salaries earned by the men in their families who work as laborers in the pineapple and banana fields of Aguas Frías.

The women have expressed great concern for the environmental devastation to the community river and health problems that their husbands and sons have developed as a result of working for the employer who owns the land. Respiratory problems, infertility and skin ailments are listed by the women of this group as common side effects of men laboring in the fields. The women attribute these negative effects to the fact that the employer provides faulty equipment, and the men are required to work with heavy, toxic chemicals in places with little or no shade. For the residents of this community, there are few employment opportunities. This daily reality describes the struggle that these women must cope with.

Edel S. F. has a sewing business and an agricultural business. She will use this loan primarily to invest in her agriculture business by purchasing watermelon, rice and squash seeds as well as agricultural nutrients. The loan will also be used to invest in the purchase of materials for making clothes which will enable her to produce more sewing products. Edel says she operates on a per order basis, her clients request a certain type of product whether it be men’s, women’s, or children’s clothing and she produces it within a given period.

Edel’s goals are to produce more, both agriculturally and in her sewing activity. She hopes to expand both businesses and increase her income. She says her main obstacle is access to working capital and this loan will help to address this challenge. Another obstacle for Edel is the fact that her sewing machine is very old and doesn’t work very well. It breaks down often, at which times she must hire a mechanic to come and repair it.

The members of this group have known each other for over ten years. They say that they prefer the group lending model to the individual lending model because, as a group, they can support each other and learn from one another.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon, rice and squash seeds as well as more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is an individual loan client with Esperanza and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. He is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long term partner and their three children.

Eddy is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza and he is excited to grow his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business, raising animals by purchasing young goats, pigs and chickens that he will look after. He will use the profits to invest in school supplies for his children and a motorcycle to facilitate his business. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Chickens, pigs and goats

loans.name: Nisley

texts.es:
Nisley A. P., tiene la edad de 35 años, está soltera, y vive sola. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Nisley  trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Nisley A. P. is 35 years old, single, and lives alone. The loan she is seeking is to assist her farm, specifically to cultivate coffee, by buying manure and fertiliser. She wants to maintain her coffee plantation well to get better quality coffee and obtain the best earnings possible when harvest time comes. This is the first time Nisley has applied for a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the facilities they offer. Nisley has worked for many years in agriculture. She hopes to have a better quality of life in the future and improved economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertiliser

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 53 años, casada con Julián y juntos tienen 2 hijos, Andy D. 21 años y Arthur D. 17 años. Todos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 20 años que resiD. al sur D. Lima, esto ayudó a que fuera bien conocida en el lugar, por lo que aprovechó para vender comida en un puesto D. venta ubicado en la parte exterior D. su casa. Su buena sazón y su gran carisma, hizo que muy pronto se hiciera D. varios clientes, quienes ahora son fieles a su establecimiento. A Lucía le agrada mucho su trabajo y es por ello que quiere mejorarlo y ampliarlo, pues le genera buenos ingresos. Por otra parte su esposo, la ayuda a elaborar algunos muebles y separadores, para que pueda dividir su cochera en dos partes, siendo una D. ellas, el puesto D. comida D. Lucia y la otra parte el taller D. carpintería D. su esposo. Ambos aportan a la economía del hogar y esperan progresar cada uno con su propio negocio y poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Este es su primer crédito con MFP  y espera ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación D. sus platillos.
texts.en:
Lucía, 53, is married to Julián; they have two children: Andy, 21 and Arthur, 17. They all live together in their own home. She has lived in south Lima for over 20 years and this has maD. her very well-known in the area. She took advantage of this and started selling prepared meals in a stand located outsiD. her house. Her great charisma and tasty seasoning quickly attracted several customers who are now her regular consumers. Lucía enjoys her work very much so she wants to enlarge and improve it because it produces good income. Her husband helps her by building some furniture and dividers so that she can diviD. her car port into two sections: one for Lucía’s food stand and the other for her husband’s carpentry shop. Both of them contribute to household expenses and each hopes to make progress with their own business so that they can proviD. their children with good educations. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with all her payments. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix R. J. tiene 22 años, esta casado con la Sra. Melvy Quispe Villarroel, tienen juntos dos hijos que son muy pequeños para asistir a la escuela. Viven actualmente en la casa de la mama de la Sra. Melvy.

El Sr. se dedica al servicio de mecanica, trabaja en un taller cerca de su casa. la Sra. Melvy cuida su ganado en su mismo domicilio, se dedica a la produccion de leche desde hace unos 7 años. Siendo este su ingreso extra para la sustentacion economica de la familia. Toda la produccion entrega a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. 

Requieren del credito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero para que su produccion incremente y generen mas ingresos. Es segundo credito que solicita al Cidre, anteriormente tuvo un credito que cancelo oportunamente.
texts.en:
Felix R. J., age 22, is married to Melvy Quispe Villarroel. They have two children who are too young to go to school. They currently live in Melvy’s mother’s house. He works as a mechanic in a shop close to his house. Melvy takes care of their livestock at home. She has worked in milk production for seven years. This is an extra income to support the family. She delivers her production to a business that makes all types of dairy products. They need the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase their production and generate more income. This is the second loan he has requested from Cidre. He previously had a loan, which he paid back in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
Fanny Ávila es socia del bankito Atenas del Ecuador, vive en  la comunidad Cisne 2 en  la parroquia Llacao situado al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, a una distancia de 14 Km. Llacao significa desprendimiento de choclos en tiempo de cosecha, tienen como atractivos turísticos la Gruta del Cerro Ripichala, la Planicie de Pachamama, El cementerio de los Incas, Apangora – Molle(ruinas Cañaris), sus habitantes se dedican a al elaboración de artesanías como: sombreros de paja toquilla, cestería y cerámica decorativa.

 Nuestra socia es separada de su esposo hace doce años, en su unión concibió cuatro hijos, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja en instalaciones de agua y luz, se pone muy triste al contarnos que su hija de 16 años falleció al llegar del colegio y  su último hijo estudia en el colegio de la localidad, disfruta  de su casa propia aunque  pequeña pero su corazón es muy grande y cálido. 

Fanny trabaja como empleada domestica desde sus cortos diez años, su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y a partir de las 3:30 empieza con su negocio de venta de pinchos, gaseosas, cervezas, vende un poco más el fin de semana, también tiene una pequeña tiendita que montó  con su primer crédito, es una socia de mucho años en el bankito pero debido al fallecimiento de su hija se separo y ahora  ingresó y ya lleva dos ciclos en él, los créditos el han beneficiado en su negocio y para el estudio de sus hijos, con su nuevo crédito comprará palillos, carne, embutidos, papas, gaseosas, cervezas, etc. para preparar sus pinchos.

Su sueño es  crecer  cada día un poco más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Fanny Ávila is a member of the Atenas del Ecuador Communal Bank. She lives in the Cisne 2 community in the Llacao parrish. It is situated 14 kilometers to the northeast of the city of Cuenca. Llacao means gathering the corn at harvest time. The tourist attractions are the grotto at Ripichala Hill, the plains of Pachamama, the Incan cemetery, and Apangora – Molle(the Cañaris ruins). The inhabitants make handicrafts like Panama hats, baskets, and decorative ceramics. Our member has been separated from her husband for two years. She has four children. Her first daughter is married and lives independently. Her second child works in water and gas installations. She becomes very sad upon telling us that her 16 year old daughter died when she was returning from school. Her last child goes to the local school. She enjoys having her own house. It may be small, but her heart is large and warm. Fanny has been working as a domestic employee since the young age of ten. Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 3 p.m. At 3:30 she starts with her business of selling snacks, soft drinks, and beer. She sells a little more on the week-end. She also has a small store that she set up with her first loan. She has been a member of the bank for many years. But, due to her daughter’s death, she left the bank. Now she has joined, and she has been in the bank for two cycles. The loans have helped with her business and her children’s education. She will use the new loan to buy skewers, meat, sausages, potatoes, soft drinks, and beer, etc. to prepare her snacks. Her dream is to grow a little more in her business everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy skewers, meat, sausages, potatoes, soft drinks, and beer, etc.

loans.name: Amigas De Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
Justina Mayta de 32 años, vive en la Zona German Busch de la ciudad de El Alto, hace 3 años aproximadamente, ella se dedica a vender  pescado, tiene su propio lugar de venta en Río Seco, frente a un surtidor y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
