Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: la venta de pescado, sombreros, comida, ropa, calzados, tejido de polleras (falda para mujer originaria), tejido de alfombras y confección de mantas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y mejorar sus negocios
texts.en:
Justina Mayta, age 32, lives in the German Busch area of the city of El Alto. She has been selling fish for approximately three years. She has her own place where she sells. It is in Río Seco in front of the gas station. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. The other members of this communal bank have economic activities like selling fish, hats, food, clothes, footwear, knitting “polleras” (skirts worn by indigenous women), weaving carpets, or making blankets. They all need the loan to invest in their businesses and to improve them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa De Jesús  C. es socia del banco Atenas del Ecuador lleva 8 años en el, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua con su  centro histórico que  fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en el año 1999. 

Nuestra socia es divorciada hace 2 años por  la infidelidad de su pareja, tiene 55 años de edad y tiene cuatro  hijos quienes tienen  37, 28, 22 y 17 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y sólo uno de  ellos vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hermano de 17 años así como pago del arriendo porque no tienen casa propia.

 Teresa realiza varias  actividades entre  ellas  vende  pinchos hace cuatro meses, también elabora guaipe (Trapos para limpiar) hace un año y realiza la limpieza de oficinas dos veces por semana de 2pm a 6pm, como es una mujer hiperactiva vende peluches sobre todo para fechas especiales.   Con el nuevo crédito va a comprar carne, palillos, papas, salsas  para sus pinchos, y también comprar peluches y algo  para el estudio de su hijo.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio grande de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesús C. has been a member of the bank Atenas del Ecuador for 8 years. She lives in a suburb of Cuenca city, capital of the Azuay province, located in the southern part of the Ecuatorian Andean ranges. This is the third most important city in Ecuador, and is characterised by its tranquility and beauty. It is an historical city and its city centre was declared a world heritage site by UNESCO in 1999. Our member has been divorced for 2 years, because of the infidelity of her partner. She is 55 years old and has 4 children - 37, 28, 22 and 17 years old. The first three children are married and only one lives with her in her house, sharing the household costs and studies, paying the rent because they don't have their own home. Teresa does various activities, including selling snacks for the past 4 months, and has also been making guaipes (cleaning clothes) for a year. She also cleans offices twice a week from 2pm - 6pm. As she is a hyperactive woman she also sells wigs, mainly for special events. With this new loan she will buy meat, toothpicks, potatoes, sauces for her snacks, purchase some wigs, and also help her son's studies. Her goals is to have a large food sale business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food, wigs, and assist paying studies

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne en la productiva parroquia de Picoaza en la provincia de Manabí en este bellos lugar sus moradores en gran mayoría son comerciantes informales, en diferentes aéreas como el comercio de ropa, hamacas, utensilio del hogar y un sinnúmero de productos.

La señora Jessenia es una de las socia que lleva 6 ciclos en este banco comunal, esta con una relación es madre de dos niños, dedica su tiempo a una guardería comunitaria en la misma parroquia, pero también se da tiempo para tener otros ingresos, que es precisamente la venta de productos de Yanbal, Avon y ropa interior, ya son dos años con las ventas, ella visita a sus clientas en las cosas toma el pedido de los productos, y en la ropa ella viaja a comprar por docenas cada cierto tiempo según como vayan las ventas, con los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación ha hecho que su negocio crezca, todo lo que es Yanbal y Avon lo compra al contado y la ropa si le dan crédito pagando según como vaya vendiendo, la misma manera ella hace con sus clientes les facilita los pagos.

Con este nuevo crédito que esta solicitando podrá comprar más mercadería y a la vez podrá ayudar al esposo a que surta su negocio, el esposo es comerciante de accesorios de teléfonos celulares, como carcasas, cargadores, y controles de televisores.

El sueño de la señora Jessenia es poder terminar su carrera de Parvularia, esta convencida que lo podrá hacer realidad le gusta mucho trabajar con niños y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde esta en la guardería sus hijos están junto a ella todo el tiempo. Esta contenta con lo que esta haciendo para ayudar a su familia a salir a delante.
texts.en:
The communal bank María José meets in the productive parish of Picoaza in the province of Manabí. The inhabitants of this beautiful place are mainly informal businesspeople. They sell different items such as clothing, hammocks, kitchen utensils and numerous other products. Jessenia is one of the members that has been with the communal bank for six cycles. She is in a relationship and is the mother of two children. She spends her time at a community nursery school in the same parish. She has another source of income selling Yanbal and Avon products and underwear. She has been doing this for two years. She visits her customers in their homes and takes their product orders. With the clothes, she travels regularly to buy them by the dozen according to how the sales are going. The loans that she has received from the Foundation have made her business grow. She pays for all of the Yanbal and Avon up front and they let her get the clothes on credit, paying according to how the sales are. By the same token, she gives her customers easy payment options. With this new loan that she is asking for, she will be able to buy more merchandise and also help her husband with his business. Her husband sells cell phone accessories such as as cases and chargers, in addition to TV remotes. Jessenia's dream is to finish her studies to become a nursery school teacher. She is convinced that she can make it a reality. She really likes to work with children and from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon she is in the nursery school. Her children are with her all the time. She is happy with what she is doing to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics and to help her husband with his cell phone accessory business.

loans.name: Roxana Erika

texts.es:
La señorita Roxana A., cuenta con 22 años, estudia en la universidad pública, es soltera es hija mayor de la familia. Roxana vive en casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona sud de de la provincia cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.La señorita Roxana se dedica a la producción de leche cruda juntamente con toda la familia, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo de la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa con habitaciones normales hechas de barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señorita Emilia es una jovencita dedicada a su trabajo así como a sus estudios, pues ella juntamente con su familia se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedica a sus estudios que piensa culminar muy pronto para poder trabajar y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y de sus padres.

La señorita Roxana solicita el crédito para la refacción de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y para la época de invierno estará desprotegida ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana A. is 22 years old. She is a public university student, single, and the eldest daughter in her family. Roxana lives with her parents in the southern area of a province near the Department of Cochabamba. She and her family members produce raw cow’s milk, which is distributed in their area and collected by the company Pil Andina. Roxana and her family live modestly. They have a regular mud-wall house, and they raise cattle on their property. Roxana is committed to her work and her studies. Her whole family gets up early every morning to milk the cows. She spends the rest of the day studying so that one day, she’ll be able to improve living conditions for herself and her family. Roxana has asked for a loan so that she can renovate her home. It needs repairs, and, by winter, could leave her family unprotected.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 38-year-old lady who is married to a driver.  She has two children who go to school. She sells milk and also does mixed farming to earn a living.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya under a group called Wangige Business Pioneers, she has been able to get more customers because she has been trained on customer care skills.  She plans to buy a dairy cow so that she can produce more milk to sell.  

Therefore, Faith has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to be the main milk supplier in her area, so she wants to increase the number of cows on her farm.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mercedes Asuncion

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes desde hace 9 ciclos forma parte del Banco Comunal María José en la parroquia Picoaza asentada en la provincia de Manabí a diez minutos del cantón Portoviejo, en esta parte de la provincia sus habitantes se dedican al comercio de diferentes áreas.

Nuestra socia es una ama de casa y a la vez una gran comerciante, tiene 38 años esta casada tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 11 años viene vendiendo semi joyas en la marca de Romanel, y luego de eso decidió emprender el negocio de las ventas de colchones y camas y para ellos acondicionó un lugar en su casa para tener su negocio, esta es una familia bien trabajadora.

El esposo se encarga de la venta de arroz por quintales la por  mayor y menor, se proveen del arroz en la ciudad de Guayaquil es ella quien se encarga de ir directamente a comprar para verificar que lo que compra es de buena calidad, ya en ocasiones ha tenido inconvenientes porque solo le enviaban hasta la casa, y tubo perdidas, en los actúeles momentos la señora  Mercedes ya cuenta con su propio capital para las semi joyas y los colchones, pero si necesita un capital para la venta de arroz y con este nuevo crédito que recibirá comprara quintales de arroz, para seguir con  la distribución del arroz es en la ciudad de Portoviejo a los clientes fijos que tiene.
texts.en:
Mercedes has been a part of the communal bank María José for nine cycles. She lives in the the parrish of Picoaza of the province of Manabí, ten minutes from the Portoviejo canton. In the part of the province, the residents have businesses in different areas. Our member is a housewife and a great sales woman as well. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. For 11 years, she has been selling Romanel semi precious jewelry. She later decided to start a business selling matresses and beds. She set up a place in her house to have the business. This is a very hardworking family. Her husband sells rice in 100-pound sacks wholesale and retail. He gets the rice from Guayaquil. She is the one who goes to make sure that what he buys is of good quallity, since at times there have been problems because they would only send it to the house and they suffered losses. At present, Mercedes has her own capital for the semi precious jewlery and the matresses, but she needs capital to sell rice. With this new loan that she will receive she will buy 100-pound sacks of rice to continue distributing rice in Portoviejo to the regular customers she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 63-year-old married lady with five children.  She owns a retail shop in her area which is a very busy environment.  She also does farming to earn more income for supporting her family.  

She saves part of her income with a group called Tuinuane in Faulu Kenya.  Being a member of this group, she can easily get a loan from Faulu Kenya because the group members guarantee each other's loans.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and soaps.  

Rose has been running her retail shop for ten years and she hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, rice, maize flour and soap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kaïraba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAÏRABA du Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE est composé de 7 femmes toutes mariées et mères d'au moins 4 enfants. Le groupe a été créé en octobre 2002 en même temps que le Banc Villageois sous l'influence de leur affinité et de leur proximité. les membres sont animés d'un même esprit, c'est-à-dire renforcer la solidarité qui existe déjà entre elle, de développer des activités génératrices de revenus afin de mieux faire faces aux difficultés économiques que rencontrent leurs familles respectives.

Madame Aïssatou C., est une femme très engagée et a une bonne culture de l'esprit de groupe. Elle est âgée de 39ans et mère de 06 enfants qui fréquentent l'école. Comme activité commerciale elle vend du sucre, du thé, de l'huile, du riz et d'autres divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à leur santé.

le prêt actuel permettra au groupe de mieux s'approvisionner à partir des marchés hebdomadaires en marchandises, à savoir: du riz, du sucre, de l'huile de palme et/ou végétale et leur lieu d'écoulement en général c'est à domicile, dans le village.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Kaïraba of the village loan group of Terembasse is composed of 7 women, all of whom are married and have at least 4 children. The group was created in 2002, at the same time as the village loan group, due to social and regional proximity. The members are driven by the same mindset, which is to strengthen the solidarity that already exists among them, and to develop their businesses in order to better deal with the economic difficulties that their respective families face. Ms. Aïssatou C., one of the members, is a very committed woman and has a good group-oriented mindset. She is 39 years old and has 6 children who attend school. As a commercial activity, she sells sugar, tea, oil, rice, and various other food products. Her goal is to participate in paying for the health and education of her children. The current loan will allow the group to better supply themselves with goods at the weekly markets, namely rice, sugar, and palm and/or vegetable oil. Their sales locations are generally at home and in their village.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the self-financing capability of the group

loans.name: Silvinio

texts.es:
Silvinio C. S., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado, y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tienen 31 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de un ternero de engorde y para su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Silvinio tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Silvinio C. S. is 55 years old. He is married and has a 31-year-old son, who is his top priority. Silvinio wants this loan to purchase a calf for fattening and cattle feed. He wants to give the cattle proper nourishment in order to earn the highest possible income at sale time. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and be able to keep them in better condition. He has a suitable area for the cattle's maintenance and growth. This is the first time he has taken out a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the services offered him. Silvinio has raised cattle for many years. He hopes in the future to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability, and he hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and a businessman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and training programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf for fattening

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne en la productiva parroquia de Picoaza en la provincia de Manabí en este bellos lugar sus moradores en gran mayoría son comerciantes formales e informales, en diferentes aéreas como el comercio de ropa, hamacas, utensilio del hogar y un sinnúmero de productos.

La señorita Rosa tiene 27 años de edad esta soltera es licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación, en la mañana trabaja en la escuela y lleva 4 años prestando sus servicios y en las tarde en el colegio donde lleva 2 años de docente, aparte de ser maestra tiene una dulcería junto a su cuñado, lleva ya 10 años en la elaboración de dulces como cocadas, ajonjolí, y otros dulces típicos de la región, la materia prima la adquiere en la ciudad de Portoviejo como coco, azúcar, todos estos productos los compra por quintales, con este nuevo crédito Rosa comprara mas material para preparar sus dulces. 

El cuñado se encarga de ayudar en la preparación de los dulces y en la administración de la micro empresa que tiene,  y es el quien se encarga de llevar a venderlos a otras ciudades del país, como Salinas, Manta y mas lugares. 

Ella es nació en Ambato y cuando tenia 1 añito de vida sus padres se vinieron a vivir a la provincia de Manabí y desde entonces residen en Picoaza.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank meets in the productive parish of Picoazá in Manabí Province. In this beautiful place, the inhabitants are mainly formal and informal businesspeople, working in different areas such as sales of clothing, hammocks, household utensils, and countless other products. Rosa is 27 years old. This single woman is licensed in Educational Sciences. In the mornings, she works at the school where she has offered her services for four years, and in the afternoons she works at the secondary school, which she has done for two years. Aside from being a teacher, she has a sweet shop together with her brother-in-law. For ten years now she has made sweets like cocadas (a sweet made with coconut, sugar and peanuts), ajonjolí, and other sweets that are typical of the region. She acquires raw materials like coconut and sugar in the city of Portoviejo. She purchases all these products 100 lb at a time. With this new loan Rosa will buy more materials for preparing her sweets. Her brother-in-law is in charge of helping to prepare the sweets and administering the micro-business, and he is in charge of bringing the sweets to cities like Salinas, Manta and other places in order to sell them. Rosa was born in Ambato, and when she was only a year old, her parents came to live in Manabí Province. Since that time, they have resided in Picoaza.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coconut and sugar

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Don Efraín es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene la edad de 41 años, junto con su esposa han logrado hacer su casa, ella trabaja como secretaria y el desde hace varios años trabaja como policía,  pues han sido varios años de experiencia sirviendo a la comunidad, aun que su salario es bajo, se siente sastifecho por la labor que hace. 
Con el crédito anterior logro hacer en frente un bajarete, con este financiamiento quiere mejorar la parte del baño, y tendedero ya que el zinc esta muy viejo, y se ve he higiénico, comprara materiales para hacer la mejora a su casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones que le permita a su familia estar segura del agua y el sol.
texts.en:
Efraín is man who is very dedicated to his work. He is 41 years old. With his wife, he has been able to build his house. She works as a secretary and for several years he has worked as a police officer. He has several years experience serving his community and although the pay is low, his work is very satisfying. With the previous loan, he was able to build a outbuilding in front. With this loan, he wants to improve the bathroom and the laundry area, since the zinc and is very old. He will buy materials to improve the house and be able to have the living conditions that will keep his family safe from the sun and the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy zinc and wood to make a stall in the bathroom

loans.name: Magaly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José pertenece a la parroquia Picoaza en la capital manabita, es un sitio muy comercial donde sus habitantes viven en comercio informal, es aquí donde cada año realizan la feria del juguete y además de tener los precios mas bajos en todas sus mercadería, aquí en este sitio hay cantidad de negocios, como la venta de ropa, accesorios para el hogar, accesorios para los celulares y mas productos desde ahí llevan a vender a otras partes de la provincia.

Al visitar este banco comunal pudimos conocer de una de las comerciantes de la parroquia, la señora Magaly, esta casada a sus 39 años tiene dos hijos y se dedica al comercio de compra y venta de hamacas (camas colgantes), en estas hamacas se utiliza el material de hilo traídas directamente de una parte de la sierra en la provincia de Imbabura extramente en Otavalo hasta ese lugar se traslada la socia a comprar a los mayoristas, pero en los últimos tiempos ya son los distribuidores que le visitan a su domicilio para entregarle los pedidos que realiza por mes.

De las ventas esta encargado el esposo es quien entrega los pedidos, ellos entregan a comerciantes que recorren el país, los precios de las hamacas están estimados entre 13, 8  y 4 dólares al por mayor, dependiendo como este la demanda hacen los pedios pero es cada 15 días lo mas habitual, ya son cliente fijos que van directamente a la casa a comprar, con el nuevo crédito que va a recibir la señora Magaly invertirá en unas 300 hamacas que tiene por entregar durante el mes. Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en más hamacas.
Nos contó que cuando inició el negocio aun manteníamos la moneda del sucre,  hace 20 años que tiene las ventas de las hamacas y esta muy conforme con su trabaja, a pesar que se desempeña como profesora en una escuela desde hace 7 años, no ha descuidado su negocio.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank is located in Picoaza parish in the capital Manabita. It is a very commercial location where the inhabitants carry out informal commerce. Here each year they have a toy fair with the lowest prices on all their merchandise. In this site are a quantity of business, selling clothing, accessories for the home, accessories for cellular phones, and many other products are shipped to other parts of the province to sell. Upon visiting the communal bank we would learn that one of the parish merchants, Mrs. Magaly, is married, 39 years old and has 2 children, and buys and sells hammocks (hanging beds). These hammocks are made with thread brought directly from the mountainous part of the province of Imbabura, near Otavalo. Magaly used to go there herself to buy wholesale, but in the last few seasons, it is the distributors who visit her house to fill her monthly orders. Her husband is in charge of delivering the orders received from merchants who cover the country. The hammocks sell for 4, 8, or 13 dollars wholesale, depending on demand. Normally, every 15 days orders are taken from fixed clients who go directly to her home. With the new loan Magaly will invest in some 300 hammocks that are to be delivered during the month. Magaly tells us that when she began her business Ecuador still used the sucre as curency. She has been selling hammocks for 20 years and enjoys her work. Despite also serving as a school teacher for the last 7 years, she has not abandoned her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING HAMMOCKS TO SELL

loans.name: 6 De Abril Group

texts.es:
David H. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal 6 de Abril que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, tiene 19 años y es vecino de la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente vive en la zona German Busch, en casa de sus padres.
 
Con el apoyo de sus padres hace dos años ha logrado instalar un taller de costura, confeccionando diferentes prendas de vestir, trabajando todos los días, ahora necesita el préstamo para adquirir materia prima como la tela. 
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: atención de tienda de barrio, artesanía en macramé, confección de bolsas, confección de polleras (falda para mujer originaria),  y venta de pescado.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
David H. is a member of the communal bank "6 de Abril," which belongs to the German Busch central office of Pro Mujer Bolivia. He is 19 years old and lives near the city of El Alto; specifically, he lives in the German Busch neighborhood in the house of his parents. With the support of his parents he managed to set up a sewing workshop two years ago, where he makes a variety of types of garments. He works every day, and now he needs a loan to buy raw materials such as fabric. The other members of the group have activities such as: running a neighborhood store, making macrame handicrafts, making purses, making polleras (traditional Bolivian skirts), and the sale of fish. They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, supplies or raw materials, according to the business that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene 63 años, ella vive sola en su casa propia, tiene dos hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes, pero de vez en cuando la visitan. Ella tiene un Bazar y librería a la vez, negocio al que se dedica desde hace 9 años, resultándole muy productivo para ella. El no tener competencia cercana, le dio mucha ventaja para captar clientes. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ya que es muy tranquilo y puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su hogar pudiéndose dedicar también a las labores de su hogar.  Hay momentos en que el trabajo les es pesado, debido a que tiene que abastecerse de mercadería y tiene que ir a uno de los mercados mayor concurrido para comprar al por mayor sus productos, lo que al final debe cargar grandes bolsas y cajas. Pero las ganas de sacar adelante su negocio hace que le de fuerzas para seguir trabajando. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y asegura que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su bazar y librería.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 63 years old, and lives alone in her own house. She has 2 children; they are adult and independent but at times they visit her. She has a shop/bookstore, a business that she has been working in for 9 years, and which has been very productive for her. She does not have competition close by, which gives her a good advantage in attracting customers. She enjoys her work very much, since it is tranquil, and she can carry it out from the comfort of her home. This allows her also to take care of the household chores. There are moments when the work is difficult, due to the fact that to restock her store with merchandise she must go to one of the very busy wholesale markets to buy her products, and then carry them back in large bags and boxes. But her desire to get ahead with her business gives her the strength to continue working. This is her first loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan that she requests she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her shop and bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Maryuri Marisol

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Lucha se reúne cada 15 días en la parroquia Picoaza se toma en llegar 10 minutos desde la capital manabita, separado por un puente por debajo de el pasa el río Portoviejo, Picoaza es uno de los sectores con mayor crecimiento comercial, donde es visitada por propios y extraños para realizar sus comprar ya que  aquí es donde uno puede encontrar diferente comercio a precios del por mayor. Es reconocida por las ferias de juguetes en navidad con los mejores precios del mercado.

En esta bella Parroquia conversamos con la socia Maryuri de 42 años de edad, desde hace 37 ciclos  forma parte del banco comunal mujeres de lucha,  es una gran profesional en arte de bordar a mano.
Se graduó en modistería hace tres años, y esta dedicada al trabajo artesanal realizado a mano como lo es el bordado, la señora Maryuri se graduó en un liceo de la parroquia donde vive, y le gusto mucho esta labor que no ha dejado de trabajar, combina la tarea del hogar y sus bordados le dedica la mitad de su tiempo, esta casada tiene tres hijos ya jóvenes.

El trabajo de la socia consiste en comprar el material como tela toalla, hilos, esponjas, piedras, chaquiras, y demás accesorios para dar por terminado su elaboración.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Maryuri comprara todo el material necesario, ya tiene varios pedidos por entregar, como foros de licuadoras de baños y mas, además tiene que ya ir armando los pie de árbol navideño, para ir visitando a sus clientas y ya ir trabajando para que nos e le acumule el trabajo le gusta ser muy responsable a la hora de entregar sus prendas.

El sueño de nuestra socia poder incrementar un buen capital y hacer mucho trabajo para ir a mostrarles a los dueños de almacenes y bazares para entregar al por mayor lo que elabora, así mismo no descarta la posibilidad de tener su propio local para exhibir lo que elabora.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha (Women in Struggle) Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza Parish. It takes 10 minutes to reach Picoaza from the capital city of Manabi, which is separated by a bridge spanning the Portoviejo River. Picoaza is one of the sectors experiencing greatest commercial growth, with visits by its own residents and outsiders to purchase items. Here one can buy wholesale. The area is known for its toy fair at Christmas, offering the best prices on the market. In this lovely parish, we spoke with Maryuri, 42 years of age, who for 37 cycles now has been a part of the Women in Struggle Communal Bank. She is an outstanding professional in hand embroidery. Three years ago she graduated in dressmaking, and she works in the craft of hand embroidery. Maryuri graduated from high school in the parish where she lives. She very much enjoys her work, and she has continued the work, sharing half of her time with household duties. She is married and has three young children. Maryuri’s work consists of buying material such as terry cloth, threads, sponges, stones, beads, and other accessories to complete the item she is making. With this new loan, Maryuri will buy all the material she needs, for she has several orders pending delivery, such as covers for blenders and steam tables. She must also be working on Christmas tree skirts, so as to call on her customers and keep the work from piling up on her. She likes to be reliable when it comes time to deliver her items. Maryuri’s dream is to accumulate a good bit of capital and produce a lot of material, to show to the owners of large stores and bazaars, to sell her work wholesale. She does not rule out the possibility of having her own store to display her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy terrycloth, threads, sponges, stones, beads

loans.name: Buen Corazon Group

texts.es:
Graciela C. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Buen Corazón  que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Exaltación, tiene 22 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, está con su grupo hace 2 años aproximadamente por invitación de sus amigas. 
Graciela elabora ruanas (son ponchos largos) hace 5 años aproximadamente, adquirió la habilidad de tejar ayudando a sus padres que también se dedican a la misma actividad, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima.
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: la venta de jugo, juguetes, perfumes, ropa, y otros. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Graciela C. is a member of the Good Heart Community Association, which in turn belongs to the Focal Point Exaltation group. She is 22 years old and is a neighbor of the city of El Alto. At the invitation of her friends, she joined the group about 2 years ago. Graciela has been making “ruanas” (which are long ponchos) for about the last 5 years, She acquired the ability to knit by helping her parents who are in same business. She needs the loan to buy raw materials. The other members of this Association engage in economic activities such as: selling juice, toys, perfumes, clothing, and other items. All of the members need a loan to buy merchandise, supplies or raw materials, according to the businesses they have.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es madre de familia de tres hijos, es muy emprendedora, tiene 36 años de edad, con una pequeña pulpería que ha venido a mejorar los ingresos de la familia. 
Su esposo trabaja en construcción en donde se le ha hecho más fácil el poder construir. Ha ido poco a poco cerrando pero por falta de dinero no logro terminar, solo le falta una parte para cerrar todo su casa, que desea hacer ante que comience el invierno en lleno y asi lograr acomodarse en mejores condiciones. Lo que permitirá mayor higiene y seguridad ante delincuencia. Estos financiamientos han venido a beneficiar las mejoras en la construcción de su casa
texts.en:
Silvia is the mother of three children. She is an enterprising 36 years old owner of a small general store. The business has increase her family's income. Her husband works in construction which has made it easier for them to build. Little by little they have been completing their house but for lack of money they have not yet finished. Only a part is missing to finish the whole house. She wishes to finish it before the winter fully arrives in order to provide better accommodations to her family. It will also provide better hygiene conditions and safety from violence. The loans have been aimed at improving the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, and other materials to finish part of the roof

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha conversamos con la señora María que desde hace 4 ciclos viene trabajando con los créditos de la Fundación.

La señora María es comerciante de legumbres en el mercado de su parroquia natal, el esposo se dedica a la venta de materiales en plásticos como baldes, cepillos, tarrinas, escobas y mas, ellos juntos invierten el dinero que reciben de la Fundación cada uno en su negocio.

La señora María viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para surtir el negocio del esposo, lo realiza dos veces al mes, y en las legumbres que es el negocio de ella es el esposo que se encarga de ir al mercado central de Portoviejo a comprar las legumbres para luego que la señora María las venda en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de Picoaza.

Este nuevo crédito que recibirá nuestra socia lo invertía en los productos que ambos venden, cada día sus negocios están creciendo y dejándoles bueno resultados en ganancias. El sueño de nuestra socia es tener su propia casa en los actúale momentos viven en casa de la mamá de ella.
texts.en:
In the communal bank "Mujeres De Lucha," we spoke with señora María, who has participated in 4 cycles of loans from the field partner Fundación. Señora María sells vegetables in the market of her native parish. Her husband makes his living selling plastics, such as buckets, brushes, small tubs, brooms and more. Together, they each invest the money they receive from Fundación in their own businesses. Señora María travels to the city of Guayaquil to stock up on items for her husband's business. She does this twice a month. As far as the vegetables, which is her business, her husband is the one who takes care of going the the central market in Portoviejo. He buys the vegetables there so that señora María can then sell them from her post at the market in Picoaza. This new loan that our member will receive will be invested in the products that both she and her husband sell. Day by day, their businesses are growing and are giving them good profits. Our member's dream is to have her own home, being that they are currently living in her mother's home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and plastics, such as buckets, brushes, small tubs and brooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina  S. es socia del banco comunal  Esperanza del Mañana, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Azogues  capital de la provincia del  Cañar, cuenta con un clima templado y es un nudo de comunicaciones. Además por  su conformación topográfica es una ciudad bien asoleada desde el punto Este culminante en la iglesia y templo del Santuario Franciscano, la topografía desciende con grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay. 

Nuestra socia es un mujer de 23 años, es madre de dos niños de cinco y tres años, su primer hijo estudia en el Jardín de Infantes de la localidad,  su esposo trabaja como oficial de un bus de transporte urbano, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

María Cristina arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad aquí montó una tienda donde vende discos compactos  con el primer crédito que recibió en su banco comunal, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 7 a.m. a 8 p.m., se encuentra en su quinto ciclo incentivada a ingresar a él por su suegra, con su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de Cd de  películas, música, videos educativos, infantiles y más  para toda la familia.

Su sueño es algún  día llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María Cristina S. is a member of the Esperanza del Mañana Communal Bank. She lives in greater Azogues, which is the capital of the Cañar province. It has a mild climate, and it is a hub of communications. Also, due to its topographical formation, the city is bathed in sun from the highest eastern point in the church and the temple of the Franciscan Sanctuary. The topography descends with great inclinations up to the banks of the Burgay River. Our member is 23 years old. She has two children, five and three years old. Her first child goes to the local kindergarten. Her husband works as a bus official in urban transportation. She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives. María Cristina rents a space in the center of the city. That is where she set up her store selling compact discs. She did this with the first loan that she received in her communal bank. Her work schedule is Monday through Sunday from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. She is in her fifth cycle. She was motivated to join by her mother-in-law. She will use the new loan to buy CDs of movies, music, educational videos, children’s CDs, and more for the whole family. Her dream is to one day have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs of movies, music, educational videos, CDs for children, and more for the whole family

loans.name: Del Valle Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal DEL VALLE. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Rosmery M. de 33 años, vive en la zona Alpacoma desde hace 5 años, se dedica a tejer chompas y lo entrega por pedidos. 
Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen varias actividades económicas como: el tejido de tapetes, venta de candados, ropa, juguetes, ladrillos, comida y costura de ropa.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Del Valle Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Exaltación community center. They have been together for approximately four years. They formed the communal bank because they needed to have capital, which would allow them to improve their businesses. Rosmery M., age 33, is one of the members. She has lived in the Alpacoma area for five years. She knits sweaters by order, and she delivers them. The rest of the members of this group have various economic activities like weaving table cloths, selling locks, clothes, toys, bricks, food, or making clothes. They all need the loan to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La joven Ana es madre soltera de tres  hijos. De edad de 29 año, pues ha sido difícil su situación económica pues solo su mama la apoyado siempre.
Ha logrado hacer su casa, ya que ahora es difícil ya que los materiales de construcción están caros,  con ahorros y financiamiento ha avanzado mucho. Su trabajo es como domestica lleva ya varios años laborando, cansado y aun que su salario es bajo tiene un trabajo seguro para poder dar lo necesario a sus hijos. Con este financiamiento comprara zinc para mejorar el techo, puertas que no pudo comprar ya que le falto dinero el cual las tiene tapando con zinc lo que le resulta inseguro por la robadera que se da en el barrio. Sus planes es lograr dar todas las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is the single mother of three children. She is 29 years old, and her economic situation has been difficult. Only her mother has always helped her. She was able to make her house. Now it is difficult because the construction materials are expensive. With savings and loans she has greatly advanced. She has worked for several years as a domestic employee. It is tiring work. Even though her salary is low, she does have secure work to be able to give her children the necessities. She will use this loan to buy zinc to improve the roof and to buy doors. She could not buy these due to lack of money. She has been covering the areas with zinc. This does not work well as protection from robbery, which exists in the neighborhood. Her plan is to be able to make all of the improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and doors to finish the improvements on her house

loans.name: Ahuehuete (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama “ AHUEHUETE (FLAT), llevan por nombre el árbol que tienen en su comunidad y que es el mas antiguo que hay en esta localidad. Las 5 personas del grupo son: Maria concepción González garcía, Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez, Gina rebeca López gatita, Emilia Hernández Carreño y Herlinda Bolaños T..

Marina es la representante del grupo, ella es mamá soltera, tien 3 hijos los cuales se llaman: Charbel Senei 16 años, Yalizet 14 años y Kathleen de 11 años, Marina tiene una tiendita de abarrotes que inicio desde que nació primer hija, tuvo la necesidad de iniciar este negocio,  por que cuando su esposo se fue y las dejo solas, ella tuvo que dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijas, no quiso separarse de ellas y pensó que una tiendita le iba a dar la facilidad de poder mantenerlas y cuidarlas al mismo tiempo. Actualmente si  tiene competencia,  pero  esto no la entristece ya que ella tiene la fortuna de que fue el primer negocio qué inicio en esta localidad (abarrotes), y la fortuna de que todo mundo la conoce.

Con este crédito, Marina piensa surtir mas su negocio por que la competencia esta dura  en su localidad, pero no quita el dedo del renglón la ventaja que tiene su negocio que esta en el centro de la comunidad y eso le esta ayudando mucho. Al mejor sus ingresos tiene la oportunidad de que sus hijas cursen una carrera,  ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, desea darles lo mejor  y que un futuro sean mejores que ellas profesionalmente hablando.

Marina se siente feliz por que con el grupo de “ Ahuehuete “ , ya que confía  en las demás integrantes las cuales son personas muy responsables, además agrade de todo corazón que Kiva y Fundación Realidad les haya dado la oportunidad de conocerlas como personas y como clientes, Ella espera que siempre las apoyen en sus proyectos y que confíen que no los van a defraudar.
texts.en:
The group is called “ AHUEHUETE (FLAT). They are named after a tree they have in their community, the oldest one in the town. The five people in the group are: Maria Concepción González García, Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez, Gina Rebeca López Gatita, Emilia Hernández Carreño y Herlinda Bolaños T.. Marina is the group's representative and she has three children who are named: Charbel Senei, 16, Yalizet, 14, and Kathleen, 11. Marina has a little grocery store that she started after her first daughter was born and she needed to start the business. When her husband left them alone, she had to take care of her daughters and didn't want to be away from them, so she thought that a little store would allow her to take care of them and support them at the same time. Right now she has competition, but that does not sadden her, since she has the good luck of having the first grocery business in the area, and the good luck that everyone knows her. With this loan, Marina is planning on diverifying her business more since the competition is hard in her area. She won't give up; the advantage is that her business is in the center of the community and this is helping her a lot. By increasing her income, she has the opportunity for her daughters to continue their studies. Since she was never able to do this, she wants to give them the best and for them to be do better in the future than she did, professionally speaking. Marina is happy with the “ Ahuehuete “ group, since she trusts the other members who are very reponsible people. She also thanks Kiva and Fundación Realidad for having given them the opportunity to get to know them as people and as customers. She hopes they will always support her projects and trust that she won't defraud them.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise wholesale to diversify her grocery store.

loans.name: Eliécer

texts.es: Eliécer C. C., tiene la edad de 33 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros de engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Eliécer tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Eliécer C. C. is 33 years old and single with no children. He currently lives with his parents. He is requesting a loan to buy some calves to feed and fatten up. He would like to provide his cattle with excellent care, so that he can receive the highest possible return when he sells them. He would also like to increase the number of animals he keeps and improve their living conditions. He has an area specifically dedicated to raising and maintaining his cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms provided to him. Eliécer has raised cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and he would like to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying calves to fatten up

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Maruchan soup, eggs, laundry soap, large sardines, sugar, rice, coal, toilet paper, chicken and soft drinks

loans.name: Zenaida Maria

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Zenaida Maria B. P. tiene 41 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, estos estudian en nivel primario y secundario en esta ciudad de Bluefields. Esta microempresaria tiene unos 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada, la que consiste en ropa para adultos, ropa para niños, ropa de cama entre otras.

Esta señora ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos anteriores los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, actualmente esta solicitando un tercer préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el mismo negocio. Además aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que depositaron su confianza en ella y entregaron el dinero para que pudiera invertirlo.

Según la microempresaria este producto se vende bastante y lo que ella hace es tener clientes que le encargan el producto y de esta manera pude estar comprando y actualizando su inventario.

Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 1 paca de Ropa usada para niños a US 100 la paca, 2 pacas de sabanas usadas a US 200 cada paca,1 paca de  toallas usadas a US 100 la paca y1 paca de  ropa usada para adultos a US 200 cada paca.
texts.en:
The micro entrepeneur, Zenaida Maria B. P., is 41, married, and has 4 children who are primary and secondary school students in this city, Bluefields. She has been selling used clothing for 7 years: clothing for adults, children, and bed linens, etc. This lady has been the recipient of 2 previous loans which she paid off on time. Currently she is asking for a third loan to purchase inventory for the same business. Also she would like to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who have shown confidence in her, and lent money that she could invest in the merchandise. According to this micro entrepreneur, these items sell well. What Zenaida does is to have her customers request certain articles of clothing, and thus she can be buying and keeping her inventory up to date. She is asking for a loan to buy the following: 1 pack of used children's clothing at $100 US the pack, 2 packs of used sheets at $200 each pack, 1 pack of used towels at $100 the pack, and 1 pack of used adult clothing at $200 each pack.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing for children, used sheets, used towels, and used clothing for adults

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su último hijo de 17 años en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a labores de ganadería, ella cría vacas y aprovecha la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador de la zona que provee de este producto a una empresa procesadora de lácteos, esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que trata de esforzarse para mantener el negocio. Para optimizar su producción ella suele alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales que adquiere a los agricultores del lugar.

Santos desea mejorar la calidad de la leche que producen sus vacas para así poder adquirir mas ingresos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado y asi lograr su objetivo.

Santos es una mujer responsable y tranquila, en la comunidad donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una persona de confianza y que siempre trata de ayudar a los que la necesitan. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder adquirir mas vacas.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, Santos has been the mother of children, and lives with her youngest son, 17 years old, in the Pomape housing section, in a rural area that is basically agricultural. It is located in the Monsefu district, nationally known for its tourist and religious festivities, and located twenty minutes from Chiclayo. Since she was young, she has worked in livestock, she raises cows and sells their milk to a local middleman, who provides the product to a dairy processing plant. This is her sole source of income, and thus she puts forth efforts to maintain the business. To optimize her production, she usually feeds her animals with natural grasses, which she gets from local farmers. Santos would like to improve the quality of milk her cows produce, to increase her earnings. For this reason she now needs to request this first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, 700 new soles, which she would use to buy balanced feed and thus achieve her goal. Santos is a calm, responsible woman. In her community, her neighbors view her as someone they can trust, who always tries to help those who need it. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a business woman and buy more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve milk cow production

loans.name: The New Club Group

texts.es:
EL SR. WILFREDO ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "EL NUEVO CLUB", INTEGRADO POR 9 SOCIOS MUY ENTUSIASTAS, QUIENES LO ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTE DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. ÉL TIENE 46 AÑOS, TIENE CINCO HIJOS; Y VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE HUAQUILLAY EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE UN AÑO INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE LA VENTA DE TELÉFONOS MÓVILES, ACCESORIOS Y SERVICIOS TÉCNICO.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO AUMENTAR SU CLIENTELA, TENER UN STOCK DE EQUIPOS, Y A LA VEZ HA IMPLEMENTADO UN NEGOCIO DE SERVICIO DE PINTURA, ESTOS NEGOCIOS LE PERMITEN MANTENER A SU FAMILIA.
MAS ADELANTE LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO FORMAR UNA EMPRESA QUE TENGA QUE VER CON EQUIPOS CELULARES, Y ESTABLECERSE EN UN LOCAL PROPIO.
CON EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE EQUIPOS CELULARES.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a member of the "El Nuevo Club" [the new club] group, made up of 9 very enthusiastic members who elected him as president of their group's management committee. He is 46 years old and has five children. They live in the Huaquillay area of the Comas district. He started his business a year ago, selling mobile phones, accessories and technical services. By working hard he has managed to increase his customer base, build up his stock and has also set up a painting and decorating business. These businesses allow him to support his family. In the future he would really like to start a mobile phone-related company, and would like to have his own store. He will us the loan requested to purchase mobile phones.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y al ultimo se sus hijos en el centro poblado menor Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, zona conocida por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y por ser tierra de artesanos. Se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace quince años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con una hectárea de terreno donde suele sembrar todo tipo de verduras y hortalizas, en esta oportunidad el ha sembrado camote. Miguel nos comenta que logró adquirir este terreno gracias a los ahorros que guardaba de su trabajo como peón agrícola en una empresa agroindustrial de la región, tan pronto se jubiló el empezó a laborar como agricultor independiente para así poder sostener a su familia.

Miguel se esfuerza al máximo para mantener su negocio y poder sacar adelante a su familia. El desea obtener una buena producción del cultivo que actualmente ha sembrado, por lo que quiere brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de camote aplicándole fertilizantes y pesticidas, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Miguel es un padre responsable, trabajador y que conoce mucho de la labor en la que se desempeña, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 61-year-old father who lives with his wife and his youngest child in the small settlement of Callanca in the Monsefú district, a region known for its religious festivals and indigenous handicrafts, which are highlights for visitors. Callanca lies 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past fifteen years, Miguel has worked in agriculture. He owns one hectare of land where he plants a wide range of vegetable crops. At present, he has planted sweet potatoes. Miguel tells us that he was able to acquire this land thanks to the money he saved up from his work as an agricultural laborer for an agro-industrial company in the area. As soon as he retired, he began working as an independent farmer so that he could support his family. Miguel works as hard as he can to keep up his business and help his family get ahead. He wants to reap a good harvest from his current crop, and so he would like to take good care of his plants by applying fertilizer and pesticides. For this reason, he has found it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will help him reach his goal. Miguel is a responsible and hard-working father who knows a lot about the work he does. His greatest desire is to be able to raise his family's quality of life. In the area where he lives, he is very well-known and highly regarded by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his sweet potato crop

loans.name: Las Coquetas Lindas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las coquetas lindas. Está ubicado en una localidad llamada La Comunidad, en Jilotepec, en el Estado de México, en México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes.

Melquiades Hernández Hernández es integrante del grupo. Tiene 50 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 7 hijos (2 mujeres y 5 varones).  Ella se dedica a la crianza de borregos que inició hace 30 años. Empezó con el negocio poco tiempo después de casada con 1 borreguito que tenía, lo creció y después le compró una borrega de pareja, con ambos empezó a sacar crías y creció el negocio, seleccionó un par para continuar con la reproducción de la especie y todos los demás los vendió junto con un caballo y un burro que tenia para ponerle loza a los cuartos de su vivienda. Con el par de borregos que conservó nuevamente se fue haciendo de más borregos y ahora solicita el préstamo para  comprar alimento y forrajes para alimentarlos, si le alcanza comprar otro borrego ya que ella quiere que su negocio crezca para obtener mayores ganancias y continuar apoyando a su esposo en la construcción de su casita pues para ellos es muy importante tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia, considera que el crédito es una buena oportunidad. 

Isabel L. D. es la tesorera de este grupo. Tiene 28 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos (una mujer y un varón).  Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para engordar los cerdos que tiene y una vez que estén listos venderlos, comprar más y así poco a poco hacer crecer su negocio pues de esta manera los ingresos aumentan y ella tiene la posibilidad de colaborar con los gastos de la casa para dar a sus hijos una mejor alimentación. Espera llegar a tener muchos cerdos para percibir mayores ganancias y un día cumplir su anhelo de terminar su cocina y tener una recamara para sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
- Esperanza Zuñiga Hijinio (Venta de abarrotes)
- Cindia A. D. (Crianza de borregos)
- Federica Hernández Hernández (Venta de verdura)
- Karina Hernández Hernández (Crianza de vacas lecheras)
- Vicenta Hernández Hernández (Venta de tortillas)
- Esther Adriana L. Hernández (Venta de Jarcería)
- Flora Hernández Hernández (Crianza de guajolotes y pollos)
- Margarita Martínez V. (Crianza de pollos)
- María Hernández Hernández (Venta de verdura)
texts.en:
This group is called the "Coquetas Lindas" (Beautiful Coquettes). They are located in an area called the Community, in Jilotepec, in the state of Mexico in Mexico. The group is made up of 11 members.

Melquiades Hernández Hernández is a member of the group. She is 50 years old, has three years of schooling, is a merchant, and has a total of 7 children (2 girls and 5 boys). Her business is raising sheep which she has been doing for 30 years. She started the business shortly after she was married with just one young sheep, which grew, and late she bought an ewe, and from there she grew the business. She picked a pair to continue breeding and the rest she sold with a horse and a burro that she had to buy dishes and crockery for her home. With the pair of lambs that kept she kept breeding more sheep and now she is asking for a loan to buy food and fodder to feed them. This will also allow her to buy more sheep and expand her business to earn more money and continue supporting her husband's efforts to construct a house for them to provide a better life for their family. She considers the loan a great opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying food and fodder

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Reque, ubicado 20 minutos al sur de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega – tienda que tiene instada en casa de sus padres, el negocio nació  de la necesidad de agenciarse de una fuente de ingresos que le permita solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento económico familiar.

El negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes ya que ella trata de brindarles un trato amable y productos de calidad, la creciente demanda por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que Rosario piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas abarrotes, de modo que pueda captar mas clientes y percibir mas ganancias; para lograr su meta ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosario es una mujer tranquila y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es poder tener un local propio donde pueda expandir poco a poco su negocio. En la zona donde vive su vecinos la consideran un joven de confianza y que siempre está dispuesta a yuadar a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Reque district, about 20 minutes south of the city of Chiclayo. For the past four years, she has dedicated herself to selling groceries and sweets from a bodega she has in her parents’ house. The business began from her need to find a source of income to cover personal expenses, as well to help her parents financially. The business is popular with her customers, given that she provides friendly service and carries quality products. Growing demand for the items she offers has led Rosario to think about expanding her business by purchasing more supplies for her store. This would help her attract additional customers and generate more profits. To meet her goal, she found herself having to request her first loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles from Epdyme Alternative. Rosario is a calm and home loving woman. Her greatest wish is to have a space of her own in which to gradually expand her business. In the zone where she lives, her neighbors consider her a young person that is trustworthy and always willing to help anyone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries to expand the business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
When Ana moved to the United States from El Salvador with her husband fifteen years ago, she found herself naturally falling into jobs that involved taking care of children. While working as an assistant at other daycare centers, “I was given more and more responsibility for the children we cared for,” she says. “Eventually, I knew it was time to open a daycare of my own.” 

Ana enrolled in classes through a program for childcare providers run by Santa Clara County and learned the ins and outs of managing a childcare facility. The same program now helps her by referring new clients, and her in-home daycare is fully enrolled with children from eighteen months to eleven years old. 

She is very proud of Cecy’s Day Care, which she runs with her husband. “I feel good doing my job,” she says. “My work helps others to be able to go to their work. I find it very gratifying, especially when I receive cards from parents to say ‘Thank You’ or for the holidays.”

Ana wanted to make improvements to her daycare, but, as an immigrant, she has not built up the credit history necessary to qualify for a small business loan from a bank.  A $10,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to purchase a computer and educational software for the children, improve the safety of her outdoor play area, and invest in new recreational equipment. These improvements will help her to attract new clients. Eventually, she and her husband hope to be able to move the daycare to a larger space outside of their home.

loans.use: Purchase computer and educational software; improve safety of outdoor play area

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VALLECITO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. LIDIA,  ella tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente  y vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia ayuda a su conyugue en la carpintería, ella da los acabados a los diferentes muebles y juntos son un equipo. Nuestra socia ahora desea el préstamo para comprar una cepilladora, cierra circular y una serda.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, dedicándose en su mayoría a prestar servicios como, las llamadas a celulares, carpintería, bisutería, alquiler de taxis, panadería, tienda de abarrotes, bazar librería, movilidad de colegio. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Vallecito” communal bank. They live in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province, in the department of Cuzco. Our member is Lidia. She is 37 years old. She lives with her partner in the San Sebastián district. She alternates her domestic activities with retail. She helps her partner with carpentry. She puts the finishing touches on the different items of furniture and together they are a team. Lidia needs the loan to buy a planer, a circular saw, and a wire brush. Our members alternate their various activities with retail, mostly in services such as renting cell phones for individual calls, carpentry, costume jewelry, taxi rides, bread store, grocery store, book store, and school transportation. Our members are requesting the loan to reinvest in their different businesses. The members are grateful for and appreciate the support provided through this program and they promise to repay their loans in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a planer, a circular saw, and a wire brush.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem S. is a married woman, 29 years old, who lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a sewing laborer in the garment industry. Besides her current work, she also stays at home to do housework and care for her child when she gets a holiday from working. 

She has a financial earner in her husband who slaughters cows for beef to sell at the market. He orders older cows from rural people to slaughter and sell. Because the cow trade is a significant source of income for buying anything the family needs, Sem S. hopes to improve this business by asking for a loan from donors via Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $800 to be used to increase the working capital of the cow trade operated by her husband.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her husband's cow trade.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. wants to find a way to improve her family's standard of living. To fulfill this aspiration in life, she joined one of Kiva's field partners, ASHI, in 2004, and felt very glad to be given the opportunity for a loan. 

She retails food vending products and has been doing so for the past six years. As a busy entrepreneur, Elizabeth has also been selling different small items for supplementary income. Building her business, Elizabeth would like to receive a loan of 20,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold  through her food vending business and support the inventories of her secondary business of retailing different goods.

She is planning to purchase additional products such as chicken, sugar, pork, milk and tuna, and the remaining money will be used to maintain her secondary business of selling small items like bath soap, shampoo, and other supplies. Elizabeth believes that offering a larger assortment of goods to customers will increase revenue from her businesses and maintain customer fidelity.

With the loan from Kiva, Elizabeth wants to resupply from wholesalers so she can better manage to offer good service and to match the needs of her customers. With her expected profits, Elizabeth wants to focus on her grandchildren's schooling and to invest in her home. 

Her long term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her businesses and to have a full-fledged expanded business.  Through hard work, Elizabeth is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and from the support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
51-year-old Teresita R.’s status in life is not as high as her dreams for herself and her family. Nevertheless, the wall of poverty that hinders her way to achieving her aspirations is not as tall nor as wide as her vision of seeing a great life behind it. The love and support of her husband and four children (whose age range is from 19 to 27 years old) create her ladder for crossing over from the border of poverty to a higher standard of living.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASHI for financial support for achieving her goals in life. Loans she received then gave her an opportunity to have her own small variety store business. This career, aside from being a wife and a mother, lifted her self confidence and has improved her sense of well being. She deals with many customers from around their village everyday, as well as attending to the needs of her family. 

Proceeds from her business enable her to augment her husband’s small income from being a driver, and have been a great source of cash flow for her family. All of Teresita’s children are laborers and have no stable job due to their low educational attainment. This situation worries her as a mother, so she wants her own business to grow and be stable through the support of the loan she is presently requesting through ASHI. 

She hopes that her small variety store will grow into a huge grocery store, and that she will be able to employ her children to work with her. By then, their standard of living will have improved.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other basic commodities to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is 43 years old. She sells different types of vegetable from her rented kiosk at the busy local market. She sells to people who come to buy things for their cooking, and she usually generates about $5 each day. Mrs. P. is a good mother to her six children, who are all single. Two of them who are no longer in school work in the construction sector, while the other four attend school. She also relies on the income from the family's other earner – her husband who works as a building foreman.
Mrs. P. finds it hard traveling frequently. She has been planning to buy a vehicle for a long time, but is not able to even though she tries to save up her personal money. She has decided to take a loan of $800 to add to her money in order to buy a motorcycle to provide transport for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: William Erick

texts.es:
William tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, no tiene hijos, el 
se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su vehiculo propio una mototaxi la 
cual adquirió hace 3 años. El ya posee experiencia en el negocio y les brinda a los 
clientes buen trato y seguridad. William tiene el anhelo de poder ver a su madre mejor 
de salud, ya que presento algunas complicaciones de salud y el ya esta apoyando en el 
tratamiento de su enfermedad. William requiere el crédito para realizar el 
mantenimiento de su mototaxi ya que el dinero lo destino para el tratamiento de su 
madre.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old, single, lives with his parents and has no children. He dedicates himself to providing transportation services with his own mototaxi, which he bought 3 years ago. He always has experience in the business, and provides an excellent and safe service for customers. William has the wish to see his mother in better health, given she has been facing some medical difficulties and he is helping to provide support for her care. William needs a loan in order to maintain his mototaxi, given that the money is destined for his mother’s treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his mode of work.

loans.name: Maricar's Group

texts.en:
Maricar U. is from the village of Bungad, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Maricar is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maricar is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Maricar owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maricar is just starting this business.

Maricar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maricar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chap

texts.en: Mrs. C., 52, plants a variety of crops on farmland she owns. She harvests and sells the crops when they come to maturity and typically earns around $4 USD per day. She lives in a commune in Battambang Province, with her husband who works with her in the field. The couple are good parents to their four children, two of whom are now married and two of whom are single. With the farming season coming, Mrs. C. doesn’t have enough supplies for her field, so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for a better harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 45 years old. Maria is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.
