Las señora Mercedes es madre soltera, tiene dos  hijos, Mercedes se dedica al negocio de la tecnología, tiene un local de venta de computadoras y se podría decir que su negocio se pude catalogar como una productora, ella trabaja junto a su hermano el dinero que solicita es para invertir en computadoras, y así incrementar su negocio, sabe que la inversión es muy importante, y por eso confía en que la Fundación le cederá el crédito que está solicitando.

Las computadoras las compra  en la ciudad de Guayaquil,   al mes invierte en 5 computadoras las trae por pedidos, la inversión se basa también en la demanda. 

El sueño de Mercedes es seguir  adelante con sus hijos y su familia, sabe que ellos solo cuentan con ella ha hecho de padre y madre y lo seguirá haciendo por el  amor que tiene  a sus hijos.
Sabe que la Fundación Espoir es uno de sus alicientes, tiene mucho que agradecer y lo hace trabajando y quedando bien en los créditos que ha obtenido, ahora confía en que la Fundación confié en ella.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes is a single mother with two children. She works in technology and has a business selling computers. She works alongside her brother. The loan she is asking for is to buy computers so that the business can be expanded. Mercedes knows that investment is very important and trusts that the Foundation will give her the money. She buys five computers each month in Guayaquil, all ordered in advance by customers. The number she buys is based on demand. Mercedes’ dream is to continue helping her children and family get ahead. She knows that they only have her to rely on. She’s been their father and mother and she will continue like this because of the love she has for her children. Kiva partner, Fundación Espoir, is an incentive for her. She wants to thank them for their work and helping out with credit. Now she hopes that the Foundation will show trust in her once again.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es:
”FLORECITAS D. VILLA HERMOSA” está conformada por 11 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes se dedican al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. varios años.
Nelly se dedica al comercio ambulatorio ella venD. ropa para todas las edades, además venD. comidas rápida que le permiten mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene 2 hijos a quienes mantener, Gracias a su trabajo pudo arreglar su casa, además D. pagar la educación D. sus hijos, ella agradece el préstamo.
Apolonia tiene una bodega en la cual trabaja más D. 10 años, su objetivo es aperturar otra bodega y mejorar su calidad D. vida. El préstamo otorgado a la socia lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes.
Con mucho esfuerzo Luis pudo comprar su mototaxi hace varios años estos ingresos le permiten ayudar a su familia el préstamo lo invertirá en arreglar algunos accesorios que le falta a su mototaxi.
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
"FLORECITAS OF VILLA HERMOSA" is a group of 11 members who are enthusiastic and fighters. They work in retail. They have worked with EDAPROSPO - prosperidad for various years. Nelly works as a street vendor. She sells clothes for all ages and also sells fast food, which enables her to improve her earnings, since she has two children to support. Thanks to her work she was able to repair her house and also pay for the education of her children. She is thankful for the loan. Apolonia has a store in which she has worked for more than 10 years. Her intent is to open another store and improve her quality of life. The loan given to this member will be invested in buying groceries. With much effort, Luis was able to buy his mototaxi and for several years these earnings let him help his family. The loan will be invested in fixing some buying that his mototaxi lacks. All of our members are grateful for the help given and promise to pay their loans. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and materiels

loans.name: Patricia Leonor

texts.es:
La señora patricia de  43 años tiene 3 hijos, maneja un negocio propio,  tiene una pequeña heladería lleva dos años con su negocio antes se dedicaba como ayudante en una escuela pero lo ha retomado,  trabaja en las mañanas en la escuela, ella vende helados de una reconocida empresa nacional,  tiene un pequeño congelador al mes invierte 120 o 150 en helados el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio, su sueño es tener una heladería grande y ver a sus hijos realizados su casa esta ubica en el centro de la ciudad.

El tiempo que Patricia dedica al  trabajo en la escuela y en la heladería hacen que ella tenga más esperanza en realizar sus sueños, ella sabe que no son imposibles, y que con la ayuda de la Fundación Espoir lo lograra. Sus tres hijos son su vida y su fuerza para seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Señora Patricia is 43 years old, has 3 children, and manages her own business. She has had a small ice-cream shop for two years now. She used to work as a helper in a grade school and has taken it up again. She works in the school in the morning and sells ice-cream from a major national brand. Patricia has a small cooler and invests 120 to 150 in ice-cream a month. She is taking out this loan to invest in her business and she dreams of having a big ice-cream shop and of seeing her children fulfilled. Her house is located in the center of the city. The time Patricia has dedicated to working the the school and to her ice-cream shop, make her hopeful about realizing her dreams. She knows that it is not impossible, and that with Fundación Espoir's help, she will achieve her dreams. Her three children are her life and the strength that keep her fighting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale ice-cream.

loans.name: Sin Testigo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sin Testigo” esta representado por el señor Jesús Reinaldo y conformado por 10 miembros 8 mujeres y 2 varones todos muy trabajadores y muy unidos. El señor Jesús Reinaldo es casado y tiene dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su propia licorería, el desea el financiamiento para poder comprar mercadería e incrementar su stock de venta, el reside en su propia casa donde se encuentra su licorería la cual atiende en dos turnos descansando solo en las mañanas. El resto de las socias se dedica a diferentes actividades como la venta de cosméticos, comida, ropa, libros y material escolar, transporte público y alquiler de motos en la plaza principal. Como todo negocio tienen competencia, pero saben como salir adelante la mayoría de los socios de este grupo tienen motocicletas de alquiler que es un negocio lucrativo en nuestra ciudad ya que la mayoría de las personas cuentan con una motocicleta para transitar. El crédito será destinado a la reparación de sus motocicletas, al incremento de su mercadería y a la construcción de algunas viviendas. En Agrocapital están en su primer ciclo sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares con la institución y la mayoría de los socios de este grupo han tenido experiencia en bancos comunales en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
Jesús Reinaldo represents the Sin Testigo group, which is comprised of ten members. There are eight women and two men in the group. They are all very hard-working and very united. Jesús Reinaldo is married and has two children. He sells drinks in his own liquor store. He wants the loan to be able to buy merchandise and increase his stock. He lives in his own house, which is where his liquor store is. He works in the store in two shifts, and he only rests in the mornings. The rest of the members work at different activities like selling cosmetics, food, clothes, books, or school supplies. Others work in public transportation and rent motorcycles in the main plaza. Like all businesses, they have competition. But, they know how to get ahead. Most of the members of this group have motorcycles that they rent. This is a lucrative business in our city. Most of the people count on a motorcycle for transportation. The loan is for repairs on their motorcycles, to increase merchandise, and to build some housing. They are in their first cycle with AgroCapital. Their previous loans with the institution were fine. Most of the members of the group have had experience in communal banks with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: El Alba Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Alba” esta representado por la señora Gardenia y conformada por 11 miembros muy trabajadores y entusiastas ellos van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución por lo que han demostrado ser socios muy responsables y honestos. La señora Gardenia ha crecido mucho con los anteriores ciclos los cuales uso para su mercadería ahora ella desea poder ampliar su puesto de venta de ropa y para ello requiere del un nuevo financiamiento que le permite darle a su hija un sustento ella no es casada pero tiene su pareja con la que convive y la apoya en sus proyectos ella vive en la casa de su madre pero desea poder independizarse y poder tener un hogar propio algún día. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de refrigerios, venta y producción de plátano, venta comida, venta de cosméticos, panadería y transporte público en moto taxis. En algunos negocios hay mas competencia que en otros,  la mayoría de las socias del grupo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya que tienen un puesto de venta en el mercado Campesino y otros ambulan por las calles para vender sus productos por lo que tienen que esforzarse para poder obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento de sus familias y su posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.  El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería, insumos, mejoramiento de sus herramientas de trabajo, reparación de sus vehículos y la construcción y remodelación de casetas y viviendas. En Agrocapital están en su tercer ciclo, sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares ya que algunas socias en ciclos anteriores han incumplido al plan de pagos y el grupo tubo que reformarse con las socias que si cumplieron con sus pagos y son responsables algunos miembros son nuevos pero cuentan con experiencia gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital
texts.en:
Gardenia represents the El Alba group. It is comprised of 11 very hard-working and enthusiastic members. They are completing their third cycle with the institution, and they have demonstrated themselves to be very responsible and honest members. Gardenia has grown a lot with the previous loan, which she used for merchandise. She now wishes to be able to expand her stall where she sells clothes. To do so she needs a new loan, which will allow her to support her daughter. She is not married, but she lives with her life partner. He supports her in her projects. She lives in her mother’s house, but she wants to be able to be independent and have her own home some day. The rest of the members sell groceries, empanadas, clothes, or refreshments. Some produce and sell bananas, sell food, sell cosmetics, have bakeries, or provide public transportation in “mototaxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). There is more competition in some businesses than others. Most of the members of the group sell groceries. They have a stall in the Mercado Campesino (country market). Other members sell their products as street vendors. They need to put forth a lot of effort to be able to get their daily income. This income supports their families and is their chance to improve their quality of life. The loan is to buy merchandise and supplies. It is to improve their work tools, to repair their vehicles, and to remodel their houses. They are in their third cycle in AgroCapital. Their previous loans were passable. In previous cycles some members did not make their payments. The group had to change itself so that the members make their payments and are responsible. Some members are new, but they have experience thanks to loans in other institutions that are similar to the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: C2147 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Regine is 39 years old, married with five children aged between 12 and 20. Regine’s husband is a businessman and they both work hard for their family. Regine is the leader of group which is called ABISUNGANYE in the local language.  Regine has an experience of four years in her business of selling clothes.

Regine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products. Regine particularly wants to purchase various styles of clothing which will help her to attract more customers. If this goal is reached, Regine will be able to earn more profit which will be reinvested into her business. With extra income Regine expects to save money as well as paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal "AMIGAS UNIDAS" se destaca por tener socias responsables y preocupadas por su familia es el caso de Esperanza quien tiene una bodega hace 8 años aperturo este negocio con mucho esfuerzo ya que atravezaba por momentos dificiles, con este negocio su situacion economica mejoro considerablemente la socia esta conforme con los prestamos lo utilizara en la compra de productos para llenar su stock.
Sonia vende carne de res hace 5 años en un pequeño Mercado de Huaycan, le fue dificil conseguir ese puesto hasta que lo logro y continua adelante ella tiene 3 hijos por quienes trabajar es por eso que se levanta temprano para comenzar con sus labores.
Hace muchos años Hilda envirtio en la construccion de su casa eso la beneficio mucho ya que ahora alquila cuartos, hace 2 años eso la ayuda a mantener su hogar, ademas se dedica a la venta de comida con su familia.
Estas son algunas de las socias que con mucho esfuerzo obtienen alguna recompensa por el bienestar de sus familia. Ellas demuestran su esfuerzo cumpliendo con sus compromisos mes a mes.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
The Community Group “AMIGAS UNIDAS” stands out thanks to its responsible and family-caring members, like Espernaza, who has been running a shop for 8 years. She was going through some difficult times, and it has been very hard for her to succeed in opening her store, but thanks to this business activity her financial situation has improved considerably. She is satisfied with the loans and she will use them to buy products to refurnish her stock. Sonia has been selling meat for 5 years in a small marketplace in Huaycan. It has been very difficult for her to obtain this job, but since she has succeeded in getting it she has been steadily working. She has 3 children she needs to provide for, and for this reason she wakes up very early to go to work. Many years ago, Hilda invested in the construction of her house: this proved to be a benefit for her, as she now rents out rooms, and for the past 2 years this income has helped her sustain her household; she moreover dedicates herself to the selling of food with her family. These are some of the women who earn a living for the wellbeing of their family through their hard work. They demonstrate their determination by complying with their commitments on a monthly basis. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Nilani

texts.en:
Nilani is a 40-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has  two daughters, and her husband works with her in the business.  

Nilani manages a grocery shop, a business which she started twenty years ago.  She is very enthusiastic about her business.

She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan  from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase goods for the shop. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial   support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.es:
Martha se dedica a diversos tipos D. negocios que le permiten mantener a su familia, ella cria y venD. aves D. corral como son pollos, patos y otros animals D. corral. Ademas venD. desayuno por las mañanas en un Mercado. Asimismo prepara humitas y tamales cuando lo solicitan ella se esfuerza mucho ya que desea invertir en la profesion D. sus hijos.
Sebastiana cria y venD. cerdos hace varios años con sus pocos ingresos desea mejorar sus criaderos y multiplicar sus cerditos para asi obtener mayors ganancias.
La secretaria Juana tiene un pequeño colegio primario donD. labora como docente, ella tiene 1 hijo, por el cual se esfuerza, ya que es su unico ingreso.
Los socios agradecen los prestamos y estan seguros D. que con esfuerzo pueden construir sus sueños. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Martha works at many different businesses that allow her to support her family. She raises and sells birds, like chickens, ducks, and other types of fowl. She also sells breakfast at the market in the morning. She prepares humitas (flavored corn paste wrapped in corn leaves) and tamales when they are requested. She works very hard because she would like to invest in her children's occupation. Sebastiana has raised and sold pigs for many years with her small income. She wants to improve her farm and increase the number of piglets she has in order to earn more money. The secretary, Juana, has a small primary school where she works as a teacher. She has one child, who is the reason she works so hard since that is her only income. The members are grateful for the loans and are sure that with effort they can build their dreams. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve agricultural businesses, food vending, and schools

loans.name: Dina Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Dina tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, cuenta con casa propia de material noble herencia de su madre,  su conyugue se dedica a la mineria artesanal y como operario de construccion actualmente no se encuentra en ica.  La Sra. Dina se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza vende productos de avon y unique, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace 3 años. La Sra. Dina tiene muchos sueños y objetivos y uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo y algunos arreglos de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Dina is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and their 2 year old daughter. She lives in a well-constructed house which she inherited from her mother. Her spouse works in mining, and because he is a construction worker they currently don't get to see each other that often. Dina works selling beauty products. She sells products made by Avon and Unique, and has been selling such products for 3 years. Señora Dina has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to own her own business. With the money that she requests, she will invest in her beauty products sales and make some repairs to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Srimathi

texts.en:
Srimathi is 39-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Telijjawila. She has four sons, aged from ten to twenty-one. Her husband works as a carpenter. Srimathi provides assistance to her husband's carpentry business, but ultimately is hoping to start a new business preparing and selling lunch packets in the near future.

She has requested a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's carpentry business. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

(Srimathi is pictured above with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Gotitas De Cristal Group

texts.es:
La sra. Micaela S. V. es presidenta de un grupo de 12 personas, cada una de ellas con una actividad diferente.
Se juntaron  por afinidad con la finalidad de reunir un grupo para solicitar un crédito a FUNDACION REALIDAD AC. El grupo se llama GOTITAS DE CRISTAL, por que menciona la presidenta que entre ella todo es transparente, todas se conocen entre si por varios años.
Algunas señoras ya han estado trabajando  con otras micro financieras  pero esta vez decidieron experimentar con esta, ya que les llama mucho la atención la bonificación por puntualidad  y el interés que es muy bajo.

La señora  Micaela es originaria de San marcos  un municipio que se ubica en la costa  chica del estado de Guerrero, Mexico.

Los habitantes de San Marcos se dedican principalmente a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
La sra. Micaela cuenta con 40 años de edad, esta casada  y cuenta con 2 hijos  de sexo masculino. Los dos en edad de primaria y secundaria, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y regalos para cualquier tipo de ocasión.
Negocio con el cual tiene mas de 5 años, el crédito lo quiere para ampliar mas su negocio en mercancías.

Otra integrante del Grupo  es la sra. Filiberta B. E., lo cual cuenta con 44 años  de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa y plantas de ornato en los pueblos, su puesto es ambulante. Ella cuenta con 5 hijos de los cuales son 2 hombres y 3 mujeres, todos en edad escolar de primaria, secundaria y bachillerato, El crédito lo quiere para surtir sus negocios de mercancías  para incrementar más sus ventas. La señora Filiberta opina que le gustaría seguir trabajando con los cerditos  de fundación para seguir incrementando sus negocios.

INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SU ACTIVIDAD

MARIANA L. C., VENTA DE ROPA. 
MICAELA S. V., VENTA DE PERFUMES Y ROPA.
FILIBERTA B. E., VENTA DE PLANTA DE HORNATO.
FELICIANA A. R., VENTA DE PAN.
MA DEL SOCORRO C. R., VENTA DE ORO. 
ROGELIA L. C., VENTA DE ABARROTES.
RODOLFINA L. C., VENTA DE QUESOS.
CELSA M. T., VENTA DE ABARROTES.
TERESA V. S.,VENTA DE COMIDA.
JUANA S. C.,VENTA DE QUESOS.
MARIA DELIA H. Q.,SERVICIO DE PELUQUERIA.
texts.en:
Micaela S. V. is the president of a group of 12 people. Each one of them has a different activity. They joined together in order to ask for a loan from Fundación Realidad AC. The name of the group is Gotitas de Cristal (Drops of Crystal). The president says that is the name because everything between them is transparent. They have known each other well for several years. Some of the women have already worked with other small loans, but this time they decided to try this. The bonus for punctuality really catches their attention, and the interest is very low. Micaela is a native and resident of San Marcos, which is a municipality located in Costa Chica in the State of Guerrero, Mexico. The inhabitants of San Marcos mainly work in agriculture and commerce. Micaela, age 40, is married and has two sons. One is in elementary school, and the other goes to high school. She sells clothes and gifts for all occasions. She has had the business for over five years. She wants the loan to increase the merchandise in her business. Filiberta B. E. is another member of the group. She is 44 years old, and she sells clothes and decorative plants in the villages. She sells door-to-door. She has five children, two boys and three girls. They are all school age and attend elementary school, middle school, or high school. She wants the loan to stock her business with merchandise in order to increase her sales. Filiberta says that she would like to keep working with loans from the Fundación in order to keep increasing her business. Members of the group and their activities: Mariana L. C.: Sells Clothes Micaela S. V.: Sells Perfume and Clothes Filiberta B. Esanislao: Sells Decorative Plants Feliciana A. R.: Sells Bread Maria del Socorro C. R.: Sells Gold Rogelio L. C.: Sells Groceries Rodolfina L. C.: Sells Cheese Celsa M. T.: Sells Groceries Teresa V. S.: Sells Food Juana S. C.: Sells Cheese Maria Delia H. Q.: Hairdresser

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the small business of selling perfume

location.town: Localidad de San Marcos, Municipio de San Marcos,

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Eduardo H. V. de  25 años de edad, es soltero sin hijos. Vive en el caserío San Matías.Tiene casa propia. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para contruir su terreno. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Eduardo is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in the San Matías community in his own house, and works in the countryside for agro-industrial enterprises. Juan is an enterprising person who, thanks to considerable efforts, came to acquire his property. Juan needs the loan to develop this property. His dream is to be able to finish his house, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the help that we are able to provide by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: A. Bernadette est née le 31 Décembre 1981 et est mariée à VIHO Bienvenu. Bernadette a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille réside à Sikècodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis deux ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Bernadette n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Parallèlement, Bernadette vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure, et de façon secondaire des tissus dans son atelier de coiffure. Bernadette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Bernadette a déja bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Bernadette désire renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, ce aui lui permettra d'accroître sa part de marché et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Bernadette sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Bernadette was born on December 31, 1981 and is married to Mr. VIHO Bienvenu.  She has two children, who are both in school.  The family has been residing in Sikècodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for two years.  The couple share in covering the various family expenses. Bernadette did not go to school, but she learned hairstyling.  She has been in this business for about ten years.  At the same time, she sells hair extensions and hair care products, as well as fabrics, in her hair salon.  She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo.  Bernadette has benefited already from two loans, which have both been repaid.  She would like to bolster her business and to increase her inventory.  This will enable her to increase her market share and to respond better to customer demand.  For these reasons, she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair care products (hair extensions, detergents, ointments, etc.)

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou S., né en 1966, est plombier de métier depuis 28 ans. Avec la rareté des marchés de plomberie, il s'est lancé dans le commerce avec l'aide de ses 2 femmes pour augmenter ses revenues.Il a commencé cette activité en 2005 et vend particulièrement de l'huile de palme, arachide, ...etc. Il va très souvent à la rencontre de ses clients pour les placer les marchandises tandis qu'une de ses femmes se charge de la vente à la maison. Cependant, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour renforcer cette activité secondaire qu'il gére avec ses femmes.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou S., born in 1966, has been a plumber by trade for 28 years.  With the low demand for plumbing, he got started in commerce with the help of his two wives in order to increase his income.  He started this business in 2005 and sells in particular palm oil, peanuts, etc.  He often goes to meet customers to deliver merchandise, while one of his wives is responsible for making sales at the house.  However, Amadou is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for bolstering this secondary business that he runs with his wives.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for resale

loans.name: Ida Minday

texts.es: Ida tiene 32 años de edad es soltera vive en la casa de su madre , casa de dos pisos de material noble  ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, ella se dedica a  la venta de adornos de casa como recorredora, y  trabaja como azafata de la empresa Soyus.Ida es una persona  joven que cuenta con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propio negocio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra de mas adornos para la venta por el dia de la madre.
texts.en:
Ida, age 32, is single and lives in her mother’s house. It is a two story house made from solid material, and it is located in the Tinguiña district. She sells home decorations by going door to door. She works as a stewardess for the Soyus Company. Ida is a young person who has goals and objectives. One of those is to be able to have her own business. She will use the requested money to buy more decoration to sell for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more decoracions

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
San Vicente, es un reflejo de la vitalidad y confianza de su gente que cuida y valora su tierra, gente de trabajo que apuesta al desarrollo, al comercio y al turismo, siendo un cantón  costero y por ser balneario es rico en fauna marina contando con una gran variedad de mariscos, que lo hacen atractivo para muchos turistas, a todas estas buenas cualidades de este hermoso cantón se suma  la buena perspectiva que tienen sus habitantes para  trabajar, y así muchos trabajan en varias actividades, como el caso de la señora Narcisa que tiene  48 años, está casada , tiene 6 hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos y  pollos ella tiene su negocio en su casa, 

Shirley hace sus compras por mayor  y a su vez  distribuye los pollo a sus cliente fijos y a otros que va adquiriendo diariamente,  al día entrega 15  aves según lo que le pidan, el dinero que esta solicitando es para invertir más en su negocio,  los huevos los entrega a las panadería y tiendas, ella no centra su atención y esfuerzos en  esta actividad, también  se dedica  a la costura, estudió para esta profesión,  Shirley  ya hace parte de la moda y no deja de coser todos los modelos que le pidan sus clientas,  su esposo es muy trabajador y dedica muchas horas a su trabajo, sabe que el esfuerzo vale la pena,  el es chofer de una granja.
El  sueño de ella  es tener su carro para movilizarse con mayor facilidad y así  distribuir su producto, cree mucho en ella misma y la ayuda que le ha brindado la Fundación, por eso no duda  de que pronto gracias a la Fundación Espoir su sueño se hará realidad
texts.en:
San Vicente is a reflection of the vitality and confidence of the people who take care of it and value its land. These are people who work in development, commerce, and tourism. Being a coastal canton, and being a seaside resort, it is rich in marine fauna with a great variety of seafood. These make it very attractive to tourists. All of these good qualities of this beautiful canton add up to the good prospect that the inhabitants have for working. Many work in various activities. That is the case with 48 year old Narcisa. She is married and has six children. She buys and sells chickens, and her business is at her house. Shirley buys wholesale. She delivers the chicken to her fixed customers and to others that she acquires daily. She delivers 15 birds a day, according to what is ordered. The money that she is requesting is to invest more in her business. She delivers the eggs to bakeries and stores. She does not focus all of her attention and efforts on this activity. She also makes clothes, which she studied as a profession. Shirley is now part of the fashion, and she sews all types of designs that her customers request. Her husband is very hard-working. He works a lot of hours, and he knows that the effort is worth it. He is the driver on a farm. Her dream is to have a car to get around more easily and delivery her products. She believes in herself a lot and in the help offered by the Fundación. Therefore, she does not doubt that soon, thanks to the Fundación Espoir, her dream will be a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and eggs wholesale

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Rafael R. A. de  56 años de edad, es conviviente. Tiene 2 hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa propia ubicada en el Caserio de la Venta Baja. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Rafael Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael is 56 years old, and has a live-in partner. Rafael has 2 children who are independent and he lives in his own house located in the Venta Baja community. Rafael works in the countryside for agro-industrial enterprises. He is an enterprising person who, thanks to his efforts, came to acquire his own property. He needs the loan to finish building his house. His dream is to finally finish construction of his home, in order to achieve a better quality of life. Rafael is very grateful for the help that we are able to offer by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FINISHING BUILDING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou D. est un agent de sécurité  dans une école privée à Guediwaye. Il est âgé de 51 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC –Centre de sauve garde depuis février 2003.Monsieur D.  a déjà bénéficié de 2 prêts antérieurs. Il n’a jamais fait les bancs et il lui fallait trouver un créneau  pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins vitaux. C’est la raison qui l’a ainsi conduit a choisir le métier de gardien. Mais dans le souci d’améliorer les conditions d’habitation de ses deux femmes et de leurs enfants respectifs qu’il  sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de ciment, fer, sable, briques et bétons en vu de construire 5 chambres supplémentaires chez lui.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou D. is a security agent in a Guediwaye private school. He is 51 years old and has been a member of the local U-IMCEC savings and loan center since February 2003. Mr. D. has already been granted two previous loans. He has never attended school and needed to find an occupation to meet his basic needs, which is why he chose to become a security guard. As he wishes to improve the living conditions of his two wives and their respective children, he is requesting a loan for 400,000 francs. The loan will serve to buy cement, iron, sand, bricks and mortar, with the aim of adding five rooms to his home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora  Mariana de Jesús  B. es socia del banco Esperanza del Mañana, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues capital de la provincia del Cañar, cuenta con un clima templado facilitando la producción de algunas frutas y verduras. Por su conformación topográfica es una ciudad bien asoleada desde el punto Este culminando en la iglesia y templo del Santuario Franciscano que  desciende con grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.

Mariana tiene 29años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido cinco  hijos que se encuentran de 13, 11, 5, 3 y 1 año, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela del sector y gracias a su esposo que trabaja en la construcción y también pinta  casas han salido adelante; la casa en la q viven es arrendada por lo que su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia. 

 Nuestra  socia se dedicaba a la venta de granos y verduras pero le fue mal por la sequia que arraso  a la región ocasionando que los precios se disparen y por ende que las ventas bajen por lo tanto, ahora se va a dedicar a vender salchipapas en la casa de una tía, Mariana lleva cinco ciclos en su banco comunal invitada por su madre a formar parte de éste equipo de mujeres emprendedoras, con el credito solicitado va a comprar todo lo necesario para montar su negocio de comida rápida como salchichas, papas, salsas, fundas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana is a member of the Esperanza del Mañana ((Hope of Tomorrow) Bank and lives in the center of Azogues City, the capital of Cañar Province. The area enjoys a temperate climate, facilitating production of some fruits and vegetables. Topographically, it is a city exposed to the sun from its culminating eastern point, the Santuario Franciscano church and temple, and descending in great inclines until the canyon of the Burgay River. Mariana is 29 years old, married, and has conceived 5 children from the union. Their ages are 13, 11, 5, 3, and 1. Her eldest 3 children study in a regional school, and thanks to her husband, who works in construction and also paints houses, they have gotten ahead. The house they live in is rented and their major dream is to have their own home. Mariana used to sell grains and vegetables but things went badly due to a drought that hit the region, causing prices to shoot up. As a result, sales fell badly. Now, she will dedicate her efforts to selling salchipapas (a sausage and potatoes dish) from her aunt's house. Mariana has been with her communal bank through 5 loan cycles. She was invited to join this team of enterprising women by her mother. With this requested loan she will buy everything necessary to begin her business of selling fast foods, including sausages, potatoes, salsas and bags.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SAUSAGES, POTATOES, SALSA, SNACKS, AND BAGS TO START A FAST FOOD BUSINESS

loans.name: Martha Victoria

texts.es:
La señora  Martha M. es socia del banco  Esperanza del Mañana, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Azogues en el sector  Peleusí de Azogues, esta localidad cuenta con un clima templado favoreciendo el cultivo de algunas frutas tropicales, también es una región bastante  asoleada desde el punto Este  hasta el  templo del Santuario Franciscano, la topografía desciende con grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.

Martha  tiene 42 años, casada y con cuatro hijos que tienen 20, 16, 14, 10 años, los cuales estudian en instituciones educativas de la localidad,  su esposo es policía y ella  vende  frutas en su puesto  propio en el mercado hace 30 años desde  las 10 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. de domingo a  domingo. Cuentan con su casa propia pero no viven en ella sino en casa de su madre  a quien cuida.  Es nuestra socia hace cinco  ciclos y con su nuevo crédito lo va comprar naranjas, manzanas, peras, uvas, naranjilla, etc.  para su negocio.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para y contar con buena salud.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha M. is a member of the Esperanza del Mañana bank. She lives in a suburb of the city Azogues in the Peleusi de Azogues sector. The area enjoys a very sunny, temperate climate that is favorable for the cultivation of different tropical fruits. From the eastern most point of this region to the Temple of the Franciscan Sanctuary the topography descends sharply until it reaches the Burgay River canyon. Martha is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 20, 16, 14, and 10 years old and who are all studying at educational institutions in the village. Her husband is a police officer and she sells fruit in her own stall in the market for 30 years now, from 10am to 6pm, every day of the week. They own their own home, but do not live in it, because they live with her mother whom they take care of. She has been a member for 5 loan cycles and with the loan she is going to buy oranges, apples, pears, grape, tangerines, etc. for her business. Her dream is to continue working and having good health.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell at the market.

loans.name: Juntos Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS POR EL PROGRESO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito D. Huanchac en L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es L.  Sra. MARIEL.,  elL. tiene 26 años D. edad, es soltera L. socia tiene 1 hijo L. socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, Nuestra socia venD. zapatillas desD. hace 3 años atrás, en L. calle trinitarias; , Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. adquisición D. mercadería. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, dedicándose en su mayoría a vender ropa, restaurantes, venta D. calzados, venta D. artefactos, y una D. ellas en el municipio D. Cusco. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the community bank, Juntos por el Progreso (Together for Progress). Our members live in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, the Department of Cusco. Our members alternate their retail activities, focusing mainly on selling clothes, shoes, and artifacts in the city of Cusco. Our members seek loans to reinvest in their different businesses. The partners appreciate and value the support provided by this means and agree to comply with the payment of their debts on time. This partner, Ms. Marion, is 26 years old, single, and has one child. She alternates between several retail activities. She has been selling shoes for 3 years on Trinitarias Street. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the acquisition of merchandise

loans.name: Bouba

texts.fr: Madame Bouba D. est une jeune commerçante de 27 ans qui habite a Ouakam. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de jus. Elle est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 3 ans. Aussi elle a une expérience  de 4 ans dans  cette  activité qu’elle a choisie par le biais de sa famille. L’objectif vise était d’éviter  le chômage. La phase qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’adaptation de son commerce et de ses produits aux besoins des acheteurs. Madame D. sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat d’un congélateur et de produits locaux (sucre, bissap, etc.) en vue d’augmenter son offre a la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Bouba D. is a 27-year-old merchant living in Ouakam. She specialises in selling juice. She has been a member of the Ouakam branch of U-IMCEC for three years. She has now accumulated four years’ experience in this activity already practiced within her family. Her initial objective was to avoid unemployment, but what interests her most now is adapting her commercial activity and products to what the customers need. Ms. D. is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs with which she will buy a freezer and local products (sugar, bissap, etc.) to provide her customers with additional offerings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest and strengthen working capital

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Madame Absa D. est femme battante de 53 ans. Elle évolue  dans le secteur de la  restauration (vente de petit déjeuner et déjeuner  depuis 8 ans. Auparavant elle vendait du riz  au port autonome de Dakar. Et du fait que le marche n’existe plus elle s’est lance dans la restauration. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’hygiène et la propreté  qui est assurée aux clients. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour acheter un stock de riz et de sucre pour les besoins de son activité. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter au prix en gros et d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Madame Deng est mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui vivent de son soutien financier. Elle est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans et souhaite renforcer sa capacité de faire face aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Absa D. is a 53-year-old woman and a fighter.  She has been advancing in the restaurant sector (selling breakfast and lunch) for eight years.  In the past, she used to sell rice at the Autonomous Port of Dakar.  Since there is no more market, she started working in food catering.  Her greatest interest in this business is hygiene and cleanliness, which she ensures for her customers.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying an inventory of rice and some sugar for business purposes.  This will enable her to buy at wholesale prices and to increase her profit margin.  Ms. Deng is married and the mother of seven children, who are supported by her financially.  She has been a member of the Ouakam branch office for five years.  She wishes to boost her ability to cope with family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting her working capital

loans.name: Azalias Flat Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA AZALIAS YA QUE ES EL NOMBRE QUE LES GUSTO PARA SU GRUPOLA CINCO INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: AMALIA A. C. QUE TIENE UNA TIENDA D. ABARROTES, FRANCIASCA T. Y CRUZ SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. PESCADO, MIRIAM VEND. ROPA Y ORLANDA VEND. COMIDA.
AMALIA ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS SE LLAMAN GUADALUPE, JUANCARLOS, LUIS DAVID, MIGUEL ANGEL Y TANIA YULIANA. ELLA QUIERE AGRANDAR MAS SU TIENDA YA QUE  EMPESO A VENDER EN UNA MESITA Y POCO A POCO FUE CRECIENDO Y ESPERA CON  EL TIEMPO CRECER MAS, ESTA SEGURA QUE SU NEGOCIA DA MUCHAS GANANCIAS YA QUE VEND. MUY BIEN Y EL TRATO QUE BRINDA A SUS CLIENTES ES D. LO MEJOR PARA ELLA  Y TODOS SUS VECINOS LE COMPRAN.
CON ESTE CREDITO SE QUIERE SURTIR MAS D. MERCANCIA COMO HUEVO, LECHE, CREMAS, PAN, REFRESCO, SABRITAS, CHILES ENLATADOS, AZUCAR, ETC. SU META EN UN FUTURO ES PODER DARLE  UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA A SUS HIJOS  Y SEGUIRLOS APOYANDO EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
DOÑA AMALIA NOS COMENTA QUE LKE GUSTA SU GRUPO POR QUE SE APOYAN Y LE GUSTA LA IDEA  D. TRABAJAR CON FRAC Y KIVA YA QUE EL INTERES ES MUY BAJO Y ELLA SE HA SENTIDO MUY BENEFICIADA Y DA GRACIAS POR AYUDARLA  A QUE SU NEGOCIO SIGA CRECIENDO
texts.en:
This group calls themselves Azalias, because they really like the name. The members of the group and their activities are: Amalia A. C., who has a convenience store. Cruz D. T. Franciasca, who sells fish; Miriam who sells clothing; and Orlando who sells food. Amalia is the representative of the group. She is married and has 5 children: Guadalupe, Juan Carlos, David Luis, Miguel Angel, Tania Yuliana. She wants to enlarge her store and have more things to sell. She started selling from a small table and little by little it grew and she hopes with time to grow even more. She is sure that her business gives good earnings because already she sells a lot. The way she treats her customers is the best and all her neighbors buy from her. With this loan she wants to supply more merchandise such as eggs, milk, cream, bread, refreshments, Sabritas, canned chiles, sugar, etc. Her goal for the future is to be able to give a better quality of life to her children and continue supporting them in their studies. Ms. Amalia tells us that she likes her group because they support her and she likes the idea of working with FRAC and Kiva and because the interest is very low. She feels very blessed and is thankful for the help with her business to continue to growing.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soap, bread, sabritas, milk, eggs, etc. for inventory.

loans.name: Abejitas Del Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal ABEJITAS DEL NUEVO AMANECER. Se agruparon hace poco por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen negocios como: la venta de bañadores plásticos, atención de tienda de barrio,  tejido de prendas de vestir, venta de cosméticos, frutas, jugo de quinua. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.

Un ejemplo claro es Virginia Q. de 28 años, tiene el negocio de elaboración de papa frita, ella compra papas grandes, las que son peladas y cortadas, luego pasa a un proceso de cocción, para finalmente ser embolsado. Ella distribuye estos productos a diferentes puntos de venta.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Abejitas del Nuevo Amanecer” (Little Bees of the New Dawn) meets every two weeks at the Pan American Community Association. They recently gathered as a group in order to access the capital needed to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have different business selling bathing suits, groceries, hand woven clothing, cosmetics, fruit juices, and quinoa. They need this loan to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

One example is Virginia Q.. She is 28 years old and has a business making potato chips. Virginia buys large potatoes that are peeled and sliced and then passes them through the cooking process before finally packaging them in bags. She distributes her products to different sales outlets.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making potato chips

loans.name: Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Emprendedoras (Movers and Shakers*), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with a long term partner and their four children.

Juana is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her "colmado" or small general store by purchasing oil, beans, rice, fish, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, cookies, bologni and mints to stock her store with. She will use the profits to save towards purchasing her own home as well as helping her children get educated to become professionals. She thanks you all for your support.

*Kiva coordinator's contextual translation

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, fish, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, cookies, bologni and mints

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal LAS EMPRENDEDORAS. Se agruparon hace aproximadamente 1 año por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen negocios como: la venta de ropa (faldas, mandiles), puertas y transporte. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.

Un ejemplo claro es Olga A. de 33 años, esa casada y vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona 6 de Junio hace 13 años, ella tiene el negocio de confección de mochilas hace 5 años, cuando tiene los productos terminados los vende en diferentes ferias.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Las Emprendendoras” (The Enterprising Women) meets every two weeks at the Pan American Community Association. They gathered as a group approximately one year ago in order to access the necessary capital to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have businesses selling clothing (skirts and aprons), manufacturing doors, and providing transportation. All of them need this loan to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

One clear example is Olga A. who is 33 years old, married, and has lived in the June 6th District of the city of El Alto for thirteen years. She has been operating a business that manufactures backpacks for five years. Her finished products are sold at different fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Peligro 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Miosty is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas de Peligro (Dangerous Women United), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with a long-term partner and their two children.

Miosty is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanz  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cellphones by purchasing cellphones, chargers and batteries to sell. She will use the profits to invest her dream of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cell phones, chargers and batteries

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Lora is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Con Esperanza (Women With Esperanza), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Lora’s group is located in the urban slums that surround Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Lora is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small cafeteria by purchasing sausages, bread, ketchup and mayonnaise as well as two glass display cases.

Lora will use the profits to reinvest in her business by moving it out of her home into its own location. Additionally, she plans to make repairs to her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more sausages, bread, ketchup and mayonnaise as well as two glass display cases

loans.name: Banco En Desarollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Acosta, 36, is the coordinator of her group, Banco en Desarollo (Bank in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Acosta’s group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children.

Acosta is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by traveling to the capitol to purchase more merchandise in the main markets.

Acosta will use her profits to purchase medicine, clothes, a computer and school supplies for her children. She would also like to repair some things in her home. Finally, her dream is to study medicine and be a doctor. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell

loans.name: La Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Martina is the coordinator of her group, La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Martina’s group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Martina is excited to be taK. her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business selling basic staples. She plans to use this loan to stock rice, sugar, yuca (cassava), plantains and bananas.

Martina will use the profits to invest in moving her business because there is too much dust where she is currently located. Also, she would like to remodel her home and to save towards putting her children through university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, yuca, plantains and bananas

loans.name: Nuevo Bankito La Ramada (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Bankito La Ramada se encuentra en Nabon ubicado a 69 Km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, conectado por la vía Panamericana que va desde Cuenca a Loja, tiene una altitud: 3.000 m.s.n.m., su clima predominante es el frío. Los límites: al norte con Sigsig y Girón al Sur con Oña y la provincia de Loja, al este con las provincias de Morona Santiago y Zamora Chinchipe; al oeste con Santa Isabel y al suroeste con la provincia de Loja, los  lugares turísticos que se puede visitar son las  ruinas de Lumapara, las playas de Nabón y varias comunidades indígenas como Shiña, su gente se dedica a la agricultura,  la ganadería y la minería. 

La señora  Gloria Carrión es socia de este banco,  vive en la comunidad  Nabón con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 16 años y cuatro meses, su hijo mayor estudia en un colegio de la localidad,  tienen casa propia pero no  viven ella sino en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Loja de donde ella es oriunda. Su esposo es comerciante de gorras mientras que ella se dedica a su tienda  de víveres  desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. todos los días de domingo a domingo.

Este es su  primer crédito  gracias a su compañera del banco que la invitó a formar parte de éste¸ con éste dinero  va  a comprar más víveres como arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, atún, fideos y artículos de limpieza y cuidado personal para abastecer su tienda. Su meta es  tener una tienda más grande.

La señora María Ercila  Y. vive en la comunidad La Ramada en el cantón Nabon, es su primer crédito y fue invitada por la presidenta del bankito, se dedica a la agricultura actividad que ha realizado casi toda su vida, todo su producción  vende en la ciudad de Cuenca en el mercado de la feria libre y también vende en su comunidad.

María Ercila  tiene 40 años, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido siete  hijos quienes se encuentran de 23, 17, 15, 14, 13, 7, 5 años, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus cuatro hijos siguientes nacieron con discapacitados son sordo mudos y los tres mas pequeños estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, tiene una casita pequeña de adobe donde comparte con ellos y  su esposo que  es jornalero, con su crédito va a comprar semillas de maíz, fréjol, arveja, etc.  para seguir con sus cultivos.

Su sueño es de tener una casita mejor y más amplia
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Bankito La Ramada” is located in Nabon, which is 69 kilometers outside of the city of Cuenca. This area is connected to the Pan American Highway that runs from Cuenca to Loja and is situated 3000 meters above sea level. The local climate is predominantly cold. Nabon is bordered to the north by Sigsig and Girón, to the south by Oña and the province of Loja, to the east by the provinces of Morona Santiago and Zamora Chinchipe, and to the west by Santa Isabel. The tourist sites that one can visit are the ruins of Lumapara, the beaches of Nabon, and various indigenous communities such as Shiña. The people engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and mining.

Sra. Gloria Carrión is a member of this Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Nabon with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 4 months. Her oldest child attends the local high school. Gloria and her husband own a home, but they do not live there. Instead, they stay at her parents’ house in the city of Loja, where is she is a native. Her husband sells caps while she manages a grocery store that is open every day from 7am to 8pm.

Gloria is receiving her first loan as a result of one of the other group members who invited her to join the Communal Bank. She will use the money to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, salt, oil, tuna, pasta, cleaning products, and toiletries to restock her business. Her goal is to have a larger store.

María Ercila Y. lives in the community of La Ramada in the canton of Nabon. She will be receiving her first loan after being invited by the Communal Bank president. María Ercila has been involved in farming activities almost her entire life. Everything she produces is sold at the open market in Cuenca or within her community.

María Ercila is 40 years old, married, and has seven children (ages 23, 17, 15, 14, 13, 7, and 5). Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. The next four children were all born with disabilities (they are deaf mutes), while the two youngest children attend the local school. María Ercila lives with her family in a small adobe house. Her husband works as a farm laborer. María Ercila will use her loan to buy seeds for planting corn, beans, peas, and other vegetables to continue her crops.

Her dream is to have a larger, nicer house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, tuna, pasta, cleaning products, and toiletries

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Nueva Luz” y está conformado por 15 socias pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a negocios de almacén, kiosco, peluquería, repostería, rosticería, comida rápida, costuras y confecciones de buzos y manteles; venta de quesos, empanadas y sopaipillas.
La socia entrevistada fue María Antonieta, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra sentada en 1º fila, en primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco y pantalón negro. Ella vende ropa de mujer, hombre y niño por encargos. Viaja 1 vez al mes a Santiago a comprar su mercadería. Invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, ya que tiene listos los pedidos. 
Su sueño es sacar adelante a su nieto, que estudia en la Universidad, y necesita mucho apoyo económico. 
A María Antonieta le ha gustado  trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que en las reuniones vive momentos muy agradables, como convivencias y educación emprendedora, la cual le ha servido mucho para acercarse a los clientes, utilizando técnicas de ventas.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank called “Nueva Luz” (New Light) consists of 15 members who are from the city of Temuco. They engage in different businesses including grocery stores, kiosks, beauty salons, bakeries, rotisseries, fast food restaurants, sewing workshops, manufacturing of sweatshirts and tablecloths, as well as the sale of cheese, turnovers, and fried pastries.

The member who was interviewed was María Antonieta, who is the president of the group. In the photograph, she is sitting on the first row to the left, wearing a jacket and black pants. She sells clothing for women, men, and children upon request. María travels once a month to Santiago to purchase her merchandise. She will invest this loan in merchandise because she has outstanding orders. Her dream is for her grandson to get ahead. He studies at the university and is need of much financial support.

María Antonieta enjoys working with Fondo Esperanza. The meetings are enjoyable moments, as are the social events and business workshops that have been helpful in showing the members how to reach more customers and utilize sales techniques.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region and is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It has several lakeside resorts where the flora and fauna are absolutely striking. Half of the residents of this region are of Mapuche descent, an indigenous people who live in Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rolando de 40 años, juntos tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con los dos menores, mientras que el mayor estudia en la ciudad y es independiente. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra flores de gladiolos, así como lechugas y alverjas, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Pese a que las faenas agrícolas son muy tediosas, no le importa, ya que le gusta mucho porque sabe bien todas las técnicas para sembrar en cantidad y con calidad; pero lo que no le gusta, es que muchas veces la siembra se hecha a perder por las plagas, pero con la practica se aprende como sembrar cada vez mejor. Dice que cuando es tiempo de cosecha se trabaja mas duro para recoger toda la producción, pero como es una labor conjunta con los miembros de su familia se hace en menos tiempo. Como Albina es una dama muy emprendedora que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, asimismo se siente satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, pues esta compuesto por mujeres trabajadoras como ella, que buscan salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Albina tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de abono, así como semillas de flores de gladiolos, que necesita para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Albina is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Rolando, age 40, and two of their three children. Her oldest child studies in the city and lives independently. She is a hardworking woman who engages in farming to earn a living. Albina plants gladiolas, lettuce, and peas with her husband and children. Even though the farm work can be tedious, she enjoys it tremendously because she knows all the techniques needed to grow in quantity and with high quality. What she does not like is dealing with pests that can spoil her crops, but with practice she has learned to improve her plantings each season. Albina says she works harder during harvest time to gather everything she produces, but with the efforts of her family members, she is able to complete the work in less time. Being an enterprising woman who always works to get ahead, Albina has plans for the future to increase her production so that she can generate more revenue.

This is her second loan with MFP. Albina is happy with the work of her Communal Bank, which consists of hardworking women like her who want to get ahead. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of compost and gladiola seeds for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & gladiola seeds

loans.name: Kolla Marca Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Alto Lima, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal KOLLA MARCA. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es Florencia P. de 43 años, recuerda que esta con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 6 años, a invitación de una amiga, ella se dedica   a la fabricación de pelotas y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar cuerina, blader y cáñamo al por mayor, ya que con ellos, fabrica su producto.
A Florencia le gusta asistir al consultorio porque la orientan sobre la salud de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “Kolla Marca” Communal Association meets every two weeks at the Alto Lima Community Center. They joined together in order to access the capital needed to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors.

One clear example is Florencia P., who is 43 years old. She recalls joining the Pro Mujer family six years ago after being invited by a friend. Florencia manufactures balls and plans to use her loan to buy imitation leather, bladders (the core of a soccer ball that holds the air, usually made of latex or synthetic rubber), and hemp in bulk so that she can continue producing her products.

Florencia enjoys going to the Pro Mujer sponsored clinic because she receives health advise for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing sports balls

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Las Golondrinas” y está conformado por 13 socias, pertenecientes a la cuidad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a negocios de repostería, costuras, venta de ropa,  humitas y empanadas.
La socia entrevistada fue Blanca, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra  en 2º fila, en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste chaqueta negra y chaleco rojo. Ella vende frutas, verduras y carbón en una camioneta que maneja su esposo. Quiere invertir este préstamo en carbón, ya que en esta época de frío es un buen negocio. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su casa o en otro lugar.
A Blanca le han servido los talleres de educación emprendedora que entrega Fondo Esperanza, para  organizar mejor su dinero.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows) and consists of 13 members who are from the city of Temuco. They engage in different businesses that include baking desserts, sewing, selling clothes, making “humitas” (a traditional dish similar to tamales), and making empanadas.

The member who was interviewed was Blanca, who is the group president. In the photograph, she is standing on the second row to the left, wearing a black jacket and red sweater. She sells fruit, vegetables, and coal from a truck that her husband drives. Blanca wants to invest her loan in coal because it is a good business since the weather is cold. Her dream is to have an established business in her home or at some other location. Blanca has served on several entrepreneurial workshops provided by Fonda Esperanza that help the members better manage their money.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region and is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It has several lakeside resorts where the flora and fauna are absolutely striking. Half of the residents of this region are of Mapuche descent, an indigenous people who live in Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coal

loans.name: Melida Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Melida J. es socia del  banco Corazones Unidos ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe considerada la más bella del país por su arquitectura y su belleza natural, sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

 Nuestra socia  es casada tiene 36 años y  concibió  cinco  hijos de 14, 13, 10, 8 y 2 años, sus dos primeros hijos estudian  en el colegio y los dos  menores en una escuela de la ciudad;  su esposo trabaja como mensajero de una empresa y ella a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace tres años, además limpia oficinas hace ya cuatro años, gracias al  esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito en la fundación y fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este hermoso grupo, los crédito obtenidos ha invertido en la compra de mercadería,  con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  cremas, tratamientos, bases, labiales,  y más cosméticos para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es comprase un auto  para entregar la mercadería a domicilio lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Sra. Melida J. is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazones Unidos” (United Hearts), which is located in the city of Cuenca, considered to be the most beautiful city in Ecuador because of its architecture and natural beauty. The cobblestone streets, winding rivers, detailed wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens shape the friendly atmosphere that attracts domestic and foreign tourists to this historical city.

Melida is 36 years old, married, and has five children (ages 14, 13, 10, 8, and 2). The two oldest children are high school students, while the next two children attend an elementary school in the city. Her husband works for a company as a messenger. Melida has been selling cosmetics through a catalog for three years. In addition, she has been cleaning offices for four years. Thanks to her hard work and that of her husband, they have been able to build their own home.

Melida is receiving her fourth loan from the Foundation. Her sister-in-law invited her to join this wonderful group. She invested her previous loans in the purchase of merchandise. This new loan will be used to buy crèmes, treatments, foundation, lipsticks, and other types of cosmetics for her demanding customers.

Her goal is to buy an automobile as soon as possible so that she can use it to carry her merchandise home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes, treatments, foundation, lipsticks, and other types of cosmetics

loans.name: Paceñitas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Alto Lima, se reúnen una vez al mes la Asociación Comunal PACEÑITAS.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios como la venta de calzados, relojes, ropa, api y comida.
Un ejemplo claro es Josefa U. de 33 años, vecina de la ciudad de El Alto hace 10 años, Josefa confecciona polleras (falda para mujer originaria) y necesita el préstamo para adquirir materia prima.
texts.en:
The “Paceñitas” Communal Association meets once a month at the Alto Lima Community Center. The members of this Association have different businesses selling shoes, watches, clothing, “api” (a beverage made of corn), and food.

One example is Josefa U., who is 33 years old and has lived in the city of El Alto for ten years. Josefa produces “polleras” (traditional skirts worn by native Bolivian women) and needs this loan to acquire more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials used in making traditional skirts

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Corazones Unidos está ubicado en la  ciudad de Cuenca urbe considerada la más bella del país por sus majestuosos templos y paisajes naturales así como sus calles empedradas, los ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica que  fue declarada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en diciembre de 1999. 

María Mercedes  tiene 47 años de edad,  vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos de  27, 19, 9, 7, 6 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y vive solo con los tres menores que aun son estudiantes de primaria en una escuela del sector,  tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a la venta de comidas en el mercado de la Feria libre  como no tiene un puesto propio tiene que recorrer todo el mercado.  Tampoco tiene casa propia aún por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue invitada por una amiga, con su nuevo crédito comprará  una carreta  y va arreglar  la que tiene para trabajar mucho mejor y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Corazones Unidos” (United Hearts) is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered to be the most beautiful city in Ecuador for its majestic temples, natural landscapes, cobblestone streets, winding rivers, detailed wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens. All of these elements help shape the friendly atmosphere of this historic city, which was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in December 1999.

María Mercedes is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 27, 19, 9, 7, and 6). Her two oldest children are married and she lives with the three younger children, who attend the local elementary school.
